original: pañcādīnavā uttarāpathe sthāṇukaṇṭakadrumapāṣāṇaśarkaraś caṇḍakukkuro duṣṭhulasamudācāro mātṛgrāmaḥ /
analyzed: pañca ādīnavāḥ uttarāpathe sthāṇu kaṇṭaka druma pāṣāṇa śarkaraḥ caṇḍa kukkuraḥ duṣṭhula samudācāraḥ mātṛgrāmaḥ
translated: There are five dangers in the northern region: stumps and thorns, rocks and gravel, fierce dogs, and the women are difficult to deal with.

analyzed: uddānam
translated: The summary:

original: ādirājyaṃ ca bhadrāśvo mathurā otalā ca /
analyzed: ādirājyam ca bhadrāśvaḥ mathurā otalā ca
translated: Ādirājya, Bhadrāśva, Mathurā, and Otalā,

original: ārāmavairaṃbhya ayodhyā ca nadī gaṅgā pretā velāmo bhavati paścimaḥ //
analyzed: ayodhyā ca nadī gaṅgā pretā velāmaḥ bhavati paścimaḥ
translated: Ārāma, Vairāmbhya, Ayodhyā, the river Ganges, the pretas, and Vālmīki is the last.

original: atha bhagavāñ chūraseneṣu janapadeṣu cārikāṃ carann ādirājyam anuprāptaḥ /
analyzed: atha bhagavām śūraseneṣu janapadeṣu cārikām caran ādirājyam anuprāptaḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One, wandering through the country of the Śūrasenas, arrived at Ādirājya.

analyzed: tatra bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam āmantrayate
translated: There the Blessed One addressed the venerable Ānanda:

original: asminn ānanda pradeśe mahāsammato rājā prathamato rājyābhiṣekenābhiṣiktaḥ /
analyzed: asmin ānanda pradeśe mahāsammataḥ rājā prathamatas rājya abhiṣekena abhiṣiktaḥ
translated: In this place, Ānanda, King Mahāsammata was first anointed with royal consecration.

original: abhiṣikto 'yaṃ ca rājñām ādirato 'syādirājyaḥ ādirājya iti saṃjñā saṃvṛttā /
analyzed: abhiṣiktaḥ yam ca rājñām sya ādirājyaḥ ādirājyaḥ iti saṃjñā saṃvṛttā
translated: He was anointed, and this is the beginning of kings. Therefore, this is Ādirājya, and the name Ādirājya came into being.

analyzed: bhadrāśvam anuprāptaḥ
translated: He arrived at Bhadrāśva.

analyzed: tatra bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam āmantrayate
translated: There the Blessed One addressed the venerable Ānanda:

original: asminn ānanda pradeśe rājño mahāsammatasya bhadram aśvaratnaṃ prādurbhūtaṃ yato 'sya bhadrāśvo bhadrāśva iti saṃjñā saṃvṛttā /
analyzed: asmin ānanda pradeśe rājñaḥ mahāsammatasya bhadram aśva ratnam prādurbhūtam yatas sya bhadrāśvaḥ bhadrāśvaḥ iti saṃjñā saṃvṛttā
translated: In this place, Ānanda, the auspicious horse-jewel of King Mahāsammata appeared, and from that it became known as Bhadrāśva.

analyzed: tatra bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam āmantrayate
translated: There the Blessed One addressed the venerable Ānanda:

original: āgamayānanda yena mathurā iti fol / GBM / /
analyzed: āgamay ānanda yena  mathurā iti
translated: Come, Ānanda, let us go to Mathurā.

original: evaṃ bhadanta ity āyuṣmān ānando bhagavataḥ pratyaśrauṣīt /
analyzed: evam bhadanta iti āyuṣmān ānandaḥ bhagavataḥ pratyaśrauṣīt
translated: Yes, Bhadanta, the venerable Ānanda replied to the Blessed One.

analyzed: atha bhagavān mathurām saṃprasthitaḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One set out for Mathurā.

original: dūrād eva nīlanīlāṃ bhagavān vanarājiṃ dṛṣṭvā punar āyuṣmantam ānandam āmantrayate /
analyzed: dūrāt eva nīla nīlām bhagavān vana rājim dṛṣṭvā punar āyuṣmantam ānandam āmantrayate
translated: Seeing from afar the dark blue forest grove, the Blessed One again addressed the Venerable Ānanda:

original: paśyasi tvam ānanda etāṃ nīlanīlāṃ vanarājim /
analyzed: paśyasi tvam ānanda etām nīla nīlām vana rājim
translated: Ānanda, do you see that dark blue forest grove?

analyzed: evam bhadanta
translated: Yes, Blessed One.

analyzed: eṣaḥ ānandaḥ uramuṇḍaḥ nāma parvataḥ
translated: Ānanda, that is the mountain named Urumuṇḍa.

original: atra mathurāyāṃ naṭo bhaṭaś ca dvau bhrātarau mama varṣaśataparinirvṛtasya vihāraṃ pratiṣṭhāpayataḥ /
analyzed: atra mathurāyām naṭaḥ bhaṭaḥ ca dvau bhrātarau mama varṣa śata parinirvṛtasya vihāram pratiṣṭhāpayataḥ
translated: Here, in Mathurā, two brothers named Naṭa and Bhaṭa, after my parinirvāṇa in one hundred years, will establish a monastery.

original: tatas tasya naṭabhaṭika iti saṃjñā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tatas tasya naṭabhaṭikaḥ iti saṃjñā bhaviṣyati
translated: Then it will be named Naṭabhaṭikā.

analyzed: agram ca bhaviṣyati msu i
translated: And it will be the foremost

analyzed: śamatha vipaśyanā anukūlānām śayana āsanānām
translated: of places for sleeping and sitting conducive to tranquility and insight.

original: adyānanda mathurāyāṃ gupto nāma gāndhikadārako bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: adya ānanda mathurāyām guptaḥ nāma gāndhika dārakaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Today, Ānanda, in Mathurā there will be a perfumer named Gupta.

original: tasya putraḥ upagupto nāma bhaviṣyati alakṣaṇako buddhaḥ /
analyzed: tasya putraḥ upaguptaḥ nāma bhaviṣyati alakṣaṇakaḥ buddhaḥ
translated: His son will be named Upagupta, a Buddha without the marks.

original: sa mama varṣoṣitasya parinirvṛtasya śāsane pravrajya buddhakāryaṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: sa mama varṣa uṣitasya parinirvṛtasya śāsane pravrajya buddha kāryam kariṣyati
translated: He will go forth in my teaching, one year after my parinirvāṇa, and will do the Buddha's work.

analyzed: mādhyandinaḥ nāmnā ānandasya bhikṣoḥ sārdhaṃvihārī
translated: Ānanda, there will be a monk named Mākandika, a companion of the monk named Ānanda.

analyzed: saḥ upaguptam pravrājayiṣyati
translated: He will cause Upagupta to go forth.

analyzed: upaguptaḥ paścimakaḥ bhaviṣyati avavādakānām
translated: Upagupta will be the last of the instructors.

analyzed: vṛkṣa vāṭikāyām guhā bhaviṣyati
translated: There will be a cave in a grove of trees.

analyzed: dairghyeṇa aṣṭādaśa hastā
translated: It will be eighteen cubits long,

analyzed: vistāreṇa dvādaśa
translated: twelve cubits wide,

analyzed: ucchrāyeṇa sapta
translated: and seven cubits high.

original: ye ye tasyāvavāde arhatvaṃ sākṣātkariṣyanti te te caturaṅgulamātrāṃ kaṭikāṃ tasyāṃ guhāyāṃ prakṣepsyante /🔽yadā sā guhā purṇā bhaviṣyati arhatkaṭikābhis tadā upaguptaḥ parinirvāsyati /
analyzed: ye ye tasya avavāde arha tvam sākṣātkariṣyanti te te catur aṅgula mātrām kaṭikām tasyām guhāyām prakṣepsyante  yadā sā guhā purṇā bhaviṣyati arhat kaṭikābhiḥ tadā upaguptaḥ parinirvāsyati
translated: Those who will realize arhatship through his instructions will throw a hip-measure of four finger-breadths into that cave.🔽When the cave is filled with those arhat hip-measures, then Upagupta will attain parinirvāṇa.

original: parinirvṛtaṃ cainaṃ tābhir evārhatkaṭikābhiḥ sametya te dhmāpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: parinirvṛtam ca enam tābhiḥ eva arhat kaṭikābhiḥ sametya te dhmāpayiṣyanti
translated: And when he has attained parinirvāṇa, they will gather together those very arhat hip-measures and cremate him.

original: bhikṣavaḥ saṃśayajātāḥ sarvasaṃśayacchettāraṃ buddhaṃ bhagavantaṃ paripapracchuḥ /
analyzed: bhikṣavaḥ saṃśaya jātāḥ sarva saṃśaya chettāram buddham bhagavantam paripapracchuḥ
translated: The monks, having doubts, asked the Blessed One, the Buddha, who removes all doubts:

original: bhadanta bhagavatā āyuṣmān upagupto 'nāgata eva bahujanānukampī vyākṛta iti /
analyzed: bhadanta bhagavatā āyuṣmān upaguptaḥ nāgataḥ eva bahu jana anukampī vyākṛtaḥ iti
translated: Venerable, the Blessed One has prophesied that the venerable Upagupta, even in the future, will be compassionate towards many people.

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: na bhikṣava etarhi yathāsāv atīte 'py adhvani bahujanahitāya pratipannas tac chṛṇuta sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca manasi kuruta bhāṣiṣye /
analyzed: na bhikṣavaḥ etarhi yathā asau atīte pi adhvani bahu jana hitāya pratipannaḥ tat śṛṇuta sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca manasi kuruta bhāṣiṣye
translated: Monks, not only now, but also in the past, he has set out for the benefit of many people. Listen to that, and keep it well in mind, I will tell it.

original: bhūtapūrvaṃ bhikṣavaḥ asyaiva urumuṇḍasya parvatasya triṣu pārśveṣu pratyekabuddhā ṛṣayo markaṭāś ca prativasanti /
analyzed: bhūta pūrvam bhikṣavaḥ asya eva urumuṇḍasya parvatasya triṣu pārśveṣu pratyekabuddhāḥ ṛṣayaḥ markaṭāḥ ca prativasanti
translated: Monks, in the past, on the three sides of this very Uruvilvā mountain, there lived Pratyekabuddhas, sages, and monkeys.

analyzed: ekasmin pārśve pañca msu i
translated: On one side, there were five hundred Pratyekabuddhas,

original: pratyekabuddhaśatāni dvitīye pañca ṛṣiśatāni tṛtīye pañca markaṭaśatāni /
analyzed: pratyekabuddha śatāni dvitīye pañca ṛṣi śatāni tṛtīye pañca markaṭa śatāni
translated: on the second side five hundred sages, and on the third side five hundred monkeys.

original: ācaritaṃ markaṭayūthapater jātaṃ jātaṃ markaṭaśāvakaṃ praghātayati /
analyzed: ācaritam markaṭa yūtha pateḥ jātam jātam markaṭa śāvakam praghātayati
translated: It was the custom of the monkey troop leader that whenever a baby monkey was born, he would kill it.

original: tatas tā markaṭyaḥ śāvakaśokābhibhūtāḥ parasparaṃ saṃjalpaṃ kartum ārabdhāḥ /
analyzed: tatas tāḥ markaṭyaḥ śāvaka śoka abhibhūtāḥ parasparam saṃjalpam kartum ārabdhāḥ
translated: Then those female monkeys, overwhelmed by grief for their young, began to converse with each other:

analyzed: śṛṇvantu bhavantyaḥ markaṭyaḥ
translated: Listen, ladies, female monkeys!

original: ayam asmākaṃ yūthapatir jātaṃ jātaṃ śāvakaṃ praghātayati /
analyzed: ayam asmākam yūtha patiḥ jātam jātam śāvakam praghātayati
translated: This leader of ours kills every baby monkey that is born.

analyzed: tat upāya saṃvidhānam kartavyam
translated: Therefore, we must devise a plan.

original: yā asmākaṃ markaṭī āpannasatvā bhavati tayā yūthapater nārocayitavyam iti /🔽yāvad apareṇa samayenānyatamā markaṭī āpannasatvā saṃvṛttā /
analyzed: yā asmākam markaṭī āpannasatvā bhavati tayā yūtha pateḥ na ārocayitavyam iti  yāvat apareṇa samayena anyatamā markaṭī āpannasatvā saṃvṛttā
translated: Any female monkey among us who becomes pregnant should not inform the leader.🔽Then, at another time, a certain female monkey became pregnant.

original: sā tābhiḥ pratigupte pradeśe gopāyitvā mūlaphalair upasthāpitā /
analyzed: sā tābhiḥ pratigupte pradeśe gopāyitvā mūla phalaiḥ upasthāpitā
translated: She was hidden by them in a secluded place and attended to with roots and fruits.

analyzed: markaṭa śāvakaḥ jātaḥ
translated: a young monkey was born.

original: so 'pi tābhiḥ pratigupte pradeśe sthāpitaḥ poṣitaḥ saṃvardhitaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ pi tābhiḥ pratigupte pradeśe sthāpitaḥ poṣitaḥ saṃvardhitaḥ
translated: She too was placed in a hidden place by them, nourished, and raised.

original: sa yadā mahān saṃvṛttas tadā tenāsau yūthapatiḥ svayūthāt pracyāvitaḥ /
analyzed: sa yadā mahān saṃvṛttaḥ tadā tena asau yūtha patiḥ sva yūthāt pracyāvitaḥ
translated: When he grew up, he expelled that leader from his own herd.

original: urumuṇḍaparvate itaś cāmutaś ca fol / GBM /🔽paribhramitum ārabdhaḥ /
analyzed: urumuṇḍa parvata itas  ca  amutas  ca  paribhramitum ārabdhaḥ
translated: On Mount Urumuṇḍa, he began to wander here and there.

analyzed: tena paribhramatā pratyekabuddhānām śabdaḥ śrutaḥ
translated: While wandering, he heard the words of the Pratyekabuddhas.

analyzed: sa teṣām sakāśam gataḥ
translated: He went to them.

original: yadā viśvastasaṃvāsaḥ saṃvṛttas MS smṛtaḥ tadā teṣāṃ mūlapatrapuṣpaphaladantakāṣṭhair upasaṃhāraṃ karoti /
analyzed: yadā viśvasta saṃvāsaḥ saṃvṛttaḥ ms smṛtaḥ tadā teṣām mūla patra puṣpa phala dantakāṣṭhaiḥ upasaṃhāram karoti
translated: When he became familiar with them, he remembered and then offered them roots, leaves, flowers, fruits, and tooth cleaners.

analyzed: te pi tasya pātra śeṣam chorayanti
translated: They also left the leftovers of their bowls for him.

original: ācaritaṃ teṣāṃ pratyekabuddhānāṃ bhuktvā bhuktvā paryaṅke niṣīdanti /
analyzed: ācaritam teṣām pratyekabuddhānām bhuktvā bhuktvā paryaṅke niṣīdanti
translated: It is the practice of those Pratyekabuddhas that after eating, they sit in the cross-legged posture.

original: so 'pi markaṭas teṣām īryāpathaṃ dṛṣṭvā paryaṅkena niṣīdati /
analyzed: saḥ pi markaṭaḥ teṣām īryāpatham dṛṣṭvā paryaṅkena niṣīdati
translated: That monkey, seeing their posture, sat in the cross-legged posture.

original: yāvad apareṇa samayena teṣāṃ pratyekabuddhānām etad abhavat /
analyzed: yāvat apareṇa samayena teṣām pratyekabuddhānām etat abhavat
translated: Then, at another time, those Pratyekabuddhas thought:

analyzed: yat asmābhiḥ anena kvātha kāyena prāptavyam
translated: What we should attain through this boiling.

original: prāptaṃ tad yan nu vayaṃ śāntaṃ nirvāṇadhātuṃ praviśema iti /
analyzed: prāptam tat yat nu vayam śāntam nirvāṇa dhātum praviśema iti
translated: We have attained what we wanted, namely, to enter the peaceful realm of nirvana.

original: tatas te jvalanatapanavarṣaṇavidyotanaprātihāryāṇi kṛtvā nirupadhiśeṣe nirvāṇadhātau parinirvṛtāḥ /
analyzed: tatas te jvalana tapana varṣaṇa vidyotana prātihāryāṇi kṛtvā nirupadhi śeṣe nirvāṇa dhātau parinirvṛtāḥ
translated: Then they performed the miracles of blazing, heating, raining, and lightning, and attained final nirvana in the realm of nirvana without remainder.

analyzed: teṣām vyutthāna kālaḥ
translated: The time for their emergence

analyzed: tasmin msu i na uttiṣṭhanti iti
translated: is when they do not arise.

original: sa markaṭas tān apaśyan dhṛtiṃ na labhate /
analyzed: sa markaṭaḥ tān a paśyan dhṛtim na labhate
translated: That monkey, not seeing them, does not find peace.

original: yāvad asau markaṭo guhāṃ praviśya teṣāṃ pratyekabuddhānāṃ cīvarāṇi vikopayitum ārabdhaḥ /
analyzed: yāvat asau markaṭaḥ guhām praviśya teṣām pratyekabuddhānām cīvarāṇi vikopayitum ārabdhaḥ
translated: Then that monkey, having entered the cave, began to disturb the robes of those pratyekabuddhas.

original: yā devatā tasyāṃ guhāyām adhyuṣitā tasyā etad abhavat /
analyzed: yā devatā tasyām guhāyām adhyuṣitā tasyāḥ etat abhavat
translated: The deity who dwelt in that cave thought this:

analyzed: mā ha eva ayam śākhāmṛgaḥ
translated: Oh no, this monkey

original: pratyekabuddhacīvarāṇi vikopayiṣyatīti dvāraṃ mahatyā śilayā pidhāyāvasthitā /
analyzed: pratyekabuddha cīvarāṇi vikopayiṣyati iti dvāram mahatyā śilayā pidhāya avasthitā
translated: will disturb the robes of the pratyekabuddhas. She blocked the door with a large rock and stayed there.

original: tato 'sau markaṭaḥ śocitvā klamitvā paridevitvā prakrāntaḥ /
analyzed: tatas sau markaṭaḥ śocitvā klamitvā paridevitvā prakrāntaḥ
translated: Then that monkey, having grieved, suffered, and lamented, departed.

analyzed: urumuṇḍa parvate samantāt parikrāmati
translated: He roams all around Mount Urumunda.

original: anabhiratitvād dhṛtiṃ na labhamāno 'vahitaśrotro manuṣyaśabdam ākāṃkṣati /
analyzed: an abhirati tvāt dhṛtim na labhamānaḥ vahita śrotraḥ manuṣya śabdam ākāṃkṣati
translated: Because he is discontented, not finding peace, with attentive ears he longs for the sound of humans.

analyzed: tena teṣām ṛṣīṇām vāc pravyāhāra śabdaḥ śrutaḥ
translated: He heard the sound of the speech of those sages.

original: sa mārgapranaṣṭa ivādhvagas tvaritatvaritaṃ teṣāṃ sakāśam upasaṃkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: sa mārga pranaṣṭaḥ iva adhvagaḥ tvarita tvaritam teṣām sakāśam upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: He quickly went to them, like a traveler who has lost his way.

original: tena ṛṣayaḥ kaṣṭāni tapāṃsi tapyante /🔽kecid ūrdhvahastakās tiṣṭhanti /
analyzed: tena ṛṣayaḥ kaṣṭāni tapāṃsi tapyante  kecid ūrdhva hastakāḥ tiṣṭhanti
translated: Those sages were practicing severe austerities.🔽Some were standing with their arms raised.

analyzed: kecid ekena pādena
translated: Some were standing on one foot.

analyzed: kecid pañcatapaḥ tapyante
translated: Some were practicing the five heats.

original: yadāsau markaṭas taiḥ sārdhaṃ viśvastasaṃvāsaḥ saṃvṛttas tadā teṣām ṛṣīṇāṃ mūlapatrapuṣpaphaladantakāṣṭhair upasaṃhāraṃ karoti /
analyzed: yadā asau markaṭaḥ taiḥ sārdham viśvasta saṃvāsaḥ saṃvṛttaḥ tadā teṣām ṛṣīṇām mūla patra puṣpa phala dantakāṣṭhaiḥ upasaṃhāram karoti
translated: When that monkey became a trusted companion with them, he offered roots, leaves, flowers, fruits, and toothbrushes to those sages.

analyzed: te pi tasya bhaikṣa śeṣam chorayanti
translated: They also left the leftovers of their alms for him.

original: sa teṣām īryāpathaṃ vyākopya pratyekabuddheryāpathaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: sa teṣām īryāpatham vyākopya pratyekabuddha īryāpatham deśayati
translated: He disturbed their deportment and taught the deportment of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: tatra ye ūrdhvahastakās teṣāṃ hastān adhaḥ kṛtvā ricchaṭāśabdaṃ ca kṛtvā purastāt paryaṅkaṃ baddhvāvatiṣṭhate /
analyzed: tatra ye ūrdhva hastakāḥ teṣām hastān adhas kṛtvā ricchaṭā śabdam ca kṛtvā purastāt paryaṅkam baddhvā avatiṣṭhate
translated: There, he lowered the arms of those who were standing with their arms raised, made the sound of snapping fingers, and sat down cross-legged in front of them.

original: ye pañcatapas tapyante teṣām agniṃ nirvāpya ricchaṭāśabdaṃ kṛtvā purastāt paryaṅkenāvatiṣṭhate /
analyzed: ye pañcatapaḥ tapyante teṣām agnim nirvāpya ricchaṭā śabdam kṛtvā purastāt paryaṅkena avatiṣṭhate
translated: He extinguished the fires of those who were practicing the five heats, made the sound of snapping fingers, and sat down cross-legged in front of them.

analyzed: tatas taiḥ ṛṣibhiḥ avavādakasya ārocitam
translated: Then those sages reported to the instructor:

analyzed: upādhyāyaḥ eṣa śākhāmṛgaḥ smākam tapaḥ vighnam karoti
translated: Teacher, this monkey is creating an obstacle to our austerities.

analyzed: taiḥ tasya vistareṇa ārocitam
translated: They reported it all in detail to him.

analyzed: sa kathayati
translated: He said:

original: bhavantaḥ smṛtimanto hy ete śākhāmṛgā bhavanti /🔽nūnam anena īryāpathena ke MSV I
analyzed: bhavantaḥ smṛtimantaḥ hi ete śākhāmṛgāḥ bhavanti  nūnam anena īryāpathena ke i
translated: Sages, these monkeys are indeed mindful.

original: ṛṣayo 'nena dṛṣṭā bhaviṣyanti /🔽yūyam api yathāsthāpitaṃ paryaṅkaṃ baddhvā niṣīdatha /
analyzed: ṛṣayaḥ nena dṛṣṭāḥ bhaviṣyanti  yūyam api yathā sthāpitam paryaṅkam baddhvā niṣīdatha
translated: Surely by this conduct, he has seen some sages.🔽You too should sit cross-legged as you are placed.

analyzed: te tathā eva paryaṅkam baddhvā niṣaṇṇāḥ
translated: They sat cross-legged just as they were.

analyzed: teṣām pūrvakāni kuśala mūlāni āmukhībhūtāni
translated: Their previous roots of good became manifest.

original: tair anācāryakair anupādhyāyakair jñānena saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣadharmān utpādya pratyekabodhiḥ sākṣātkṛtas teṣāṃ markaṭasyāntike dharmānvayaḥ
analyzed: taiḥ an ācāryakaiḥ an upādhyāyakaiḥ jñānena saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣa dharmān utpādya pratyeka bodhiḥ sākṣātkṛtaḥ teṣām markaṭasya antike dharma anvayaḥ  /
translated: Without a teacher or preceptor, they produced the thirty-seven factors of awakening through knowledge, and actualized individual awakening. They had faith in the Dharma and lineage towards the monkey.

original: prasāda utpannaḥ /🔽te yāni navaśasyāni fol / GBM /
analyzed: prasādaḥ utpannaḥ  te yad PNNe nava śasya
translated: Faith arose in them.🔽Those who had obtained alms from the country, the new crops,

original: navaphalāni navartukāni janapadāt piṇḍapātaṃ pratilabhate tāni tasmai prathamato datvā tata ātmanaḥ paribhuñjate /
analyzed: nava phalāni nava ṛtukāni janapadāt piṇḍapātam pratilabhate tāni tasmai prathamatas da tvā tatas ātmanaḥ paribhuñjate
translated: the new fruits, and the new season, first gave them to him, and then they themselves enjoyed them.

original: tāvad apareṇa samayena sa markaṭaḥ kālagataḥ /
analyzed: tāvat apareṇa samayena sa markaṭaḥ kālagataḥ
translated: Then, after some time, that monkey died.

original: tatas taiḥ pratyekabuddhair nānādigdeśādhiṣṭhāneṣu gandhakāṣṭhāni samādāpya sarvagandhakāṣṭhaiś citāṃ citvā dhmāpitaḥ
analyzed: tatas taiḥ pratyekabuddhaiḥ nānā diś deśa adhiṣṭhāneṣu gandha kāṣṭhāni samādāpya sarva gandha kāṣṭhaiḥ citām citvā dhmāpitaḥ
translated: Then those Pratyekabuddhas collected fragrant woods from various regions and cremated him with all the fragrant woods.

analyzed: kim manyadhve bhikṣavaḥ
translated: Monks, what do you think?

original: yo 'sau pratyekabuddhaiḥ saṃpoṣito markaṭaḥ sa evāsāv upaguptaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ sau pratyekabuddhaiḥ saṃpoṣitaḥ markaṭaḥ saḥ eva asau upaguptaḥ
translated: That monkey who was nourished by the Pratyekabuddhas is none other than this Upāli.

original: tadāpy asau bahujanahitāya pratipannaḥ etarhy apy asau mayā bahujanahitānukampī vyākṛta iti /
analyzed: tadā api asau bahu jana hitāya pratipannaḥ etarhi api asau mayā bahu jana hita anukampī vyākṛtaḥ iti
translated: Then too he was engaged in the welfare of many people, and now too he has been prophesied by me to be compassionate towards the welfare of many people.

original: atha bhagavāñ chūraseneṣu janapadeṣu cārikāṃ caran mathurām anuprāptaḥ /
analyzed: atha bhagavān śūraseneṣu janapadeṣu cārikām caran mathurām anuprāptaḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One, wandering through the country of the Shurasenas, arrived at Mathura.

original: aśrauṣur māthurā brāhmaṇāḥ śramaṇo gautamo mathurām anuprāptaḥ /
analyzed: aśrauṣuḥ māthurāḥ brāhmaṇāḥ śramaṇaḥ gautamaḥ mathurām anuprāptaḥ
translated: The Brahmins of Mathura heard, The ascetic Gautama has arrived at Mathura.

original: so 'tyarthaṃ cāturvarṇaviśuddhiṃ rocayati dīpayati prajñapayati prasthāpayati virujati vivṛṇoti uttānīkaroti deśayati /
analyzed: saḥ tyartham cāturvarṇa viśuddhim rocayati dīpayati prajñapayati prasthāpayati virujati vivṛṇoti uttānīkaroti deśayati
translated: He greatly approves of, illuminates, establishes, promotes, clarifies, and explains the purity of the four castes.

original: yady asau mathurāṃ pravekṣyati asmākaṃ lābhāntarāyo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yadi asau mathurām pravekṣyati asmākam lābha antarāyaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: If he enters Mathura, it will obstruct our gains.

analyzed: sa ca asatkāra bhītaḥ śrūyate
translated: And it is said that he is afraid of disrespect.

original: yadi tasya kaścid asatkāraṃ kuryād evam asau mathurāṃ na praviśet iti cāsya nīcapuruṣo 'satkāraṃ kuryāt MSV I
analyzed: yadi tasya kaścid asatkāram kuryāt evam asau mathurām na praviśet iti ca asya nīca puruṣaḥ satkāram kuryāt
translated: If someone were to show disrespect to him, he would not enter Mathurā. And some low person would show disrespect to him.

analyzed: pravekṣyati na citrīkariṣyati
translated: He would enter and not make it splendid.

original: yady asya pradhānapuruṣaḥ kaścid asatkāraṃ kuryāc chobhanaṃ syāt /
analyzed: yadi asya pradhānapuruṣaḥ kaścid asatkāram kuryāt śobhanam syāt
translated: If some important person were to show disrespect to him, it would be good.

analyzed: tat kaḥ smākam pradhāna puruṣaḥ
translated: Who is our important person?

original: tena khalu samayena mathurāyāṃ nīlabhūtir nāma brāhmaṇo vedavedāṅgapāragaḥ svavādoddyotakaḥ paravādanigrahasamarthaḥ /
analyzed: tena khalu samayena mathurāyām nīlabhūtiḥ nāma brāhmaṇaḥ veda vedāṅga pāragaḥ sva vāda uddyotakaḥ paravāda nigraha samarthaḥ
translated: At that time, in Mathurā, there was a brahmin named Nīlabhūti, who had mastered the Vedas and Vedāṅgas, who illuminated his own doctrine, and was able to refute the doctrines of others.

analyzed: tasya vāc satya anuparivartinī
translated: His speech was true and followed by others.

original: tato māthurā brāhmaṇāḥ saṅgamya samāgamya nīlabhūteḥ sakāśam upasaṃkrāntāḥ /
analyzed: tatas māthurāḥ brāhmaṇāḥ saṅgamya samāgamya nīlabhūteḥ sakāśam upasaṃkrāntāḥ
translated: Then the brahmins of Mathurā, having assembled and gathered together, approached Nīlabhūti.

original: upādhyāya śrūyate śramaṇo gautamo ihāgata iti /
analyzed: upādhyāya śrūyate śramaṇaḥ gautamaḥ iha āgataḥ iti
translated: Teacher, it is heard that the ascetic Gautama has come here.

analyzed: saḥ tyartham cāturvarṇa viśuddhim pūrvavat yāvat saṃprakāśayati
translated: He greatly proclaims the purification of the four castes, as before, up to he illuminates.

analyzed: sa ca asatkāra bhītaḥ śrūyate
translated: And it is heard that he is afraid of disrespect.

original: yadi tasya kaścid asatkāraṃ kuryād evam asau mathurāṃ na pravekṣyati /
analyzed: yadi tasya kaścid asatkāram kuryāt evam asau mathurām na pravekṣyati
translated: If someone were to show disrespect to him, he would not enter Mathurā.

original: yadi cāsya nīcapuruṣo 'satkāraṃ kariṣyati na citrīkariṣyati /
analyzed: yadi ca asya nīca puruṣaḥ satkāram kariṣyati na citrīkariṣyati
translated: If a low person were to disrespect him, he would not be upset.

original: yady asya pradhānapuruṣaḥ kaścid asatkāraṃ kuryāc chobhanaṃ syāt /
analyzed: yadi asya pradhānapuruṣaḥ kaścid asatkāram kuryāt śobhanam syāt
translated: If some important person were to disrespect him, it would be good.

analyzed: tatas u smākam kaḥ pradhānapuruṣaḥ ṛte upādhyāyāt
translated: Then who is our important person, except the teacher?

analyzed: tvam asya asatkāram kuru vāgdaṇḍaiḥ ākrośaya
translated: You should disrespect him, scold him with harsh words.

analyzed: nīlabhūtiḥ kathayati
translated: Nīlabhūti said:

original: bhavanto mameyaṃ jihvā satyānupravartinī /🔽yady ākrośārho bhaviṣyati ākrokṣyāmi /
analyzed: bhavantaḥ mama iyam jihvā satya anupravartinī  yadi ākrośa arhaḥ bhaviṣyati ākrokṣyāmi
translated: Sirs, this tongue of mine speaks only the truth.🔽If he deserves to be scolded, I will scold him.

original: atha stavārhas toṣyāmīti /🔽tato nīlabhūtir brāhmaṇo vṛddhavṛddhair mathurānivāsibhir brāhmaṇaiḥ saṃpuraskṛto yena bhagavāṃs tenopasaṃkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: atha stava arhaḥ toṣyāmi iti  tatas nīlabhūtiḥ brāhmaṇaḥ vṛddha vṛddhaiḥ mathurā nivāsibhiḥ brāhmaṇaiḥ saṃ puraskṛtaḥ yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: If he deserves praise, I will please him.🔽Then the brahmin Nīlabhūti, honored by the very old brahmins living in Mathurā, approached the Blessed One.

original: adrākṣīn nīlabhūtir brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṃ dūrād eva dvātriṃśatā mahāpuruṣalakṣaṇaiḥ
analyzed: adrākṣīt nīlabhūtiḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam dūrāt eva dvātriṃśatā mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇaiḥ
translated: The brahmin Nīlabhūti saw the Blessed One from a distance, adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great man,

original: samalaṃkṛtam aśītyā cānuvyañjanair virājitagātraṃ vyomaprabhālaṅkṛtaṃ sūryasahasrātirekaprabhaṃ MSV I
analyzed: samalaṃkṛtam aśītyā ca anuvyañjanaiḥ virājita gātram vyoma prabhā alaṅkṛtam sūrya sahasra atireka prabham
translated: his body radiant with the eighty minor marks, shining like the sky, his radiance surpassing a thousand suns,

original: jaṃgamam iva ratnaparvataṃ samantato bhadrakam anyataraṃ vṛkṣamūlaṃ niśritya śāntena īryāpathena niṣaṇṇam /
analyzed: jaṃgamam iva ratna parvatam samantataḥ bhadrakam anyataram vṛkṣa mūlam niśritya śāntena īryāpathena niṣaṇṇam
translated: like a moving jeweled mountain, all around auspicious, seated at the foot of a certain tree, in a peaceful posture.

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca vismaya utphulla dṛṣṭiḥ stotum  ārabdhaḥ
translated: And having seen him, with eyes wide with wonder, he began to praise him.

original: praṇidhāya manaḥ sahendriyair vidhivad fol / GBM /
analyzed: praṇidhāya manaḥ saha  indriyaiḥ vidhivat
translated: Having directed his mind and senses properly,

analyzed: vāc ca śarīram eva ca
translated: and also his speech and body,

analyzed: guṇa bhūta mahā guṇa udadheḥ tava vakṣyāmi guṇa eka deśa tām
translated: I will speak of a mere fraction of the qualities of you, the ocean of great qualities.

analyzed: parama pravaraḥ si vādinām anavadyaḥ su samāhita indriyaḥ
translated: You are the supreme of speakers, faultless, with well-controlled senses,

analyzed: parama artha vid a prakampitaḥ prayataiḥ sarva para pravādibhiḥ
translated: knower of the ultimate truth, unshakable, by all the rival teachers who strive (against you).

original: caraṇaṃ susamāptam eva te susamāptavrata sādhitavrataḥ /
analyzed: caraṇam su samāptam eva te su samāpta vrata sādhita vrataḥ
translated: Your conduct is well-completed, you have fulfilled your vows, you who have accomplished your vows.

original: balavāṃś ca samādhir avyayas tava nārāyaṇaśailarājavat //
analyzed: balavān ca samādhiḥ avyayaḥ tava nārāyaṇa śailarāja vat
translated: And your strength, concentration, and imperishability are like the king of mountains, Mount Narayana.

original: puruṣarṣabha nāsti te vyathā na viṣādo na bhayaṃ na ca klamaḥ /
analyzed: puruṣa ṛṣabha nā asti te vyathā na viṣādaḥ na bhayam na ca klamaḥ
translated: O bull among men, you have no pain, no dejection, no fear, and no fatigue.

original: na ca te vyasanaṃ kutaḥ kalir na ca bhūteṣu kadācid akṣamā //
analyzed: na ca te vyasanam kutas kaliḥ na ca bhūteṣu kadācid akṣamā
translated: You have no calamity, no quarrel, and never any intolerance towards beings.

original: na ca dhāvasi nātilīyase na ca santapyasi nāpi hṛṣyase /
analyzed: na ca dhāvasi na atilīyase na ca santapyasi nā api hṛṣyase
translated: You do not run, you do not shrink back, you are not tormented, and you do not rejoice.

original: satataṃ śubham eva te manaḥ satataṃ merur ivācalādhipaḥ //
analyzed: satatam śubham eva te manaḥ satatam meruḥ iva acala adhipaḥ
translated: Your mind is always pure, like Meru, the king of mountains.

original: munipuṅgava sarvadhātubhir vipulaṃ jñānam apāvṛtaṃ tava /
analyzed: muni puṅgava sarva dhātubhiḥ vipulam jñānam apāvṛtam tava
translated: O chief of sages, your vast and unobstructed knowledge encompasses all elements.

analyzed: a parāhatam a kṣaya vyayam vividheṣu āyataneṣu vartase
translated: You abide in various abodes, unsullied, imperishable, and inexhaustible.

original: na ca te 'sti mune kathaṃkathā vimatir nāsti na saṃśayaḥ kvacit /
analyzed: na ca te sti mune kathaṃkathā vimatiḥ nā asti na saṃśayaḥ kvacid
translated: O sage, you have no doubt, no uncertainty, no hesitation.

original: svayam eva na te parāparaṃ viditaṃ sarvam avedi vidyayā //
analyzed: svayam eva na te parāparam viditam sarvam avedi vidyayā
translated: You know by yourself the highest and the lowest, and you know everything through knowledge.
You are dear to the pleasant-looking, dear to the good, dear to the dear, dear to the wise.

original: samam eva hi te priyāpriyaṃ satataṃ prītikaras tatheryase //
analyzed: samam eva hi te priya apriyam satatam prīti karaḥ tathā īryase
translated: To you, the pleasant and the unpleasant are the same, and your fame always brings joy.

analyzed: madhura pratibhānavān asi smita vākyaḥ smṛtimān viśāradaḥ
translated: You have a sweet eloquence, a smiling speech, a mindfulness, a fearlessness.

original: vividānumataṃ prabhāṣase triṣu lokeṣu ca te stṛtaṃ yaśaḥ /
analyzed: vivida anumatam prabhāṣase triṣu lokeṣu ca te stṛtam yaśaḥ
translated: You speak what is approved by the wise, and your fame spreads in the three worlds.

analyzed: nṛ sura asura yakṣa rākṣasāḥ bahavaḥ tvām ihaloka paṇḍitāḥ
translated: Many humans, gods, asuras, yakshas, and rakshasas, the wise of this world,

original: upagamya mune punaḥ punaḥ paripṛcchanti na cābhiṣūyase //
analyzed: upagamya mune punar punar paripṛcchanti na ca abhiṣūyase
translated: Approach you again and again, O sage, and ask questions, but you are not annoyed.

analyzed: sva vacaḥ paritoṣitāḥ tvayā naradevāḥ sura yakṣa rākṣasāḥ
translated: The gods, the yakshas, and the rakshasas are satisfied by your own words.

original: pratiyānti vinītasaṃśayāś caraṇau vandya ca te mahāmune //
analyzed: pratiyānti vinīta saṃśayāḥ caraṇau vandya ca te mahā mune
translated: And return with their doubts dispelled, bowing at your feet, O Great Sage.

original: sthitam āsitam āgataṃ gataṃ śayitaṃ maunam athābhyudīritam /
analyzed: sthitam āsitam āgatam gatam śayitam maunam atha abhyudīritam
translated: Standing, sitting, coming, going, lying down, silent, or speaking,

original: atha cīvarapātradhāraṇaṃ ruciraṃ gautama sarvam eva te //
analyzed: atha cīvara pātra dhāraṇam ruciram gautama sarvam eva te
translated: O Gautama, all your bearing of robes and alms bowl is delightful.

analyzed: avilambitam adrutam samam svara mādhurya guṇaiḥ samanvitam
translated: Not too slow, not too fast, even, endowed with the qualities of a sweet voice,

original: vacanaṃ punar uktavarjitaṃ samaye vyāharase narottama //
analyzed: vacanam punar ukta varjitam samaye vyāharase nara uttama
translated: You speak at the right time, O best of men, with words free from repetition.

original: balavān asi lokaviśrutaḥ puruṣajñaḥ puruṣarṣabhaḥ prabhuḥ /
analyzed: balavān asi loka viśrutaḥ puruṣa jñaḥ puruṣa ṛṣabhaḥ prabhuḥ
translated: You are powerful, renowned in the world, a knower of men, a bull among men, a lord,

original: na ca manyasi nāvamanyase sakalaṃ lokam imaṃ sadaivatam //
analyzed: na ca manyasi na avamanyase sakalam lokam imam sa daivatam
translated: But you do not think highly of yourself or look down on this entire world with its gods.

original: na ca vismayase kadācana prakṛtistheṣu calācaleṣu ca /
analyzed: na ca vismayase kadācana prakṛti stheṣu cala acaleṣu ca
translated: You are never amazed at things that are natural, whether moving or still,

original: suhṛdeṣu ca durhṛdeṣu ca pratikūleṣv anulomavatsu ca //🔽paridevyam adīnanisvanaṃ srutalālārpitasannināditam /🔽paridāhavidāhasaṃyutaṃ bhayarogajvaraśokakarṣitam //
analyzed: suhṛdeṣu ca durhṛdeṣu ca pratikūleṣu anulomavatsu ca  paridevyam adīna nisvanam sruta lālā arpita sannināditam  paridāha vidāha saṃyutam bhaya roga jvara śoka karṣitam
translated: Whether they are friendly, hostile, or indifferent.🔽Seeing the world afflicted with various hundreds of sufferings,🔽With cries of lamentation, not faint, resounding with the sounds of flowing tears,

original: prasamīkṣya jagat samākulaṃ vividhair duḥkhaśatair upadrutam /
analyzed: prasamīkṣya jagat samākulam vividhaiḥ duḥkha śataiḥ upadrutam
translated: With burning fever, combined with grief, afflicted by fear, illness, fever, and sorrow,

analyzed: cirarātram anātham utsukam bhava tṛṣṇā prasṛtam tamaḥ vṛtam
translated: For a long time, helpless, anxious, immersed in the craving for existence, enveloped in darkness.

original: avatārya muner mahākṛpāṃ vividhāṃ cātmagatāṃ prabhāvatām /
analyzed: avatārya muneḥ mahā kṛpām vividhām ca ātma gatām prabhāva tām
translated: Having brought down the great compassion of the Sage and your own various powers,

original: svayam eva hi śākyapuṅgava vyathitān mocayituṃ tvam udyataḥ //
analyzed: svayam eva hi śākya puṅgava vyathitān mocayitum tvam udyataḥ
translated: You, the foremost of the Shakyas, are indeed striving to liberate those who are afflicted.

original: bhavaduḥkham idaṃ sahetukaṃ bhavaduḥkhasya ca yaḥ parikṣayaḥ /
analyzed: bhava duḥkham idam sa hetukam bhava duḥkhasya ca yaḥ parikṣayaḥ
translated: This existence and suffering with its cause, and the complete destruction of existence and suffering,

analyzed: bhava duḥkha nirodha gāminī pratipad ca apratimam tvayā ucyate
translated: And the path leading to the cessation of existence and suffering is taught by you in an incomparable way.

analyzed: ativīrya mahā vināyaka pravarāṇām anuvādinām vara
translated: O you of great courage, supreme among those who follow the best of guides,

original: na ca te sadṛśaḥ kuto 'dhikas triṣu lokeṣv api naiva vidyate //🔽pratighānunayā fol / GBM /🔽na santi te na ca te santi mune parisravāḥ /
analyzed: na ca te sadṛśaḥ kutas dhikaḥ triṣu lokeṣu api nā eva vidyate  pratigha anunaya  na santi te na ca te santi mune parisravāḥ
translated: There is no one equal to you, let alone superior to you, in the three worlds.🔽You have no anger or affection, O Sage,🔽You have no outflows, and you have no disputes,

original: anurodhavirodhavigrahāḥ satataṃ suvrata naiva naiva te //🔽apahāya mune priyāpriye sukhaduḥkhe viṣamaṃ samaṃ tathā /
analyzed: anurodha virodha vigrahāḥ satatam suvrata na eva na eva te  apahāya mune priya apriye sukha duḥkhe viṣamam samam tathā
translated: You are always free from favoritism and opposition, O one of good vows.🔽Having abandoned what is dear and what is not dear, O Sage, pleasure and pain, what is uneven and what is even,

original: aratiṃ ca ratiṃ viparyayann upaśāntaś carasīha saṃyataḥ //
analyzed: aratim ca ratim viparyayan upaśāntaḥ carasi iha saṃyataḥ
translated: And having turned away delight and aversion, you wander here in tranquility and restraint.

original: vyasane na ca nāma nirmanā na ca nāmonnamase praśaṃsayā /
analyzed: vyasane na ca nāma nirmanāḥ na ca nāma unnamase praśaṃsayā
translated: You are not elated in prosperity, nor cast down in adversity.

original: ayaśaś ca yaśaś ca te samaṃ samam ākruṣṭam athāpi vanditam //
analyzed: ayaśaḥ ca yaśaḥ ca te samam samam ākruṣṭam atha api vanditam
translated: You are the same in fame and in disgrace, in praise and in blame.

original: ativākyam atho titikṣase puruṣaṃ pāpajanair udīritam /
analyzed: ati vākyam atho titikṣase puruṣam pāpa janaiḥ udīritam
translated: You bear with the harsh words spoken by wicked people.

original: samarāgragato viṣāṇavān bhṛśamuktān iva kuñjaraḥ śarān //🔽suvacas tvam ṛṣe vacaḥkṣamaḥ sudurukteṣv api nābhiṣūyase /
analyzed: samara agra gataḥ viṣāṇavān bhṛśa muktān iva kuñjaraḥ śarān  su vacaḥ tvam ṛṣe vacaḥ kṣamaḥ su durukteṣu api na abhiṣūyase
translated: Like an elephant in the forefront of battle, you endure the arrows shot at you.🔽O Sage, you are easy to speak to, you are patient with words, even with very harsh words you are not agitated.

original: samam eva ca vartase mune paribhāṣāsu śubhāsu vākṣu ca //
analyzed: samam eva ca vartase mune paribhāṣāsu śubhāsu vākṣu ca
translated: You remain the same, O Sage, in insults and in praise.

analyzed: satatam ca vara arha pūjyase nara deva asura yakṣa rākṣasaiḥ
translated: You are always worthy of worship, revered by gods, men, demons, yakshas, and rakshasas.

original: ṛṣibhiś ca sadā mahātmabhir na ca te vikriyate sthiraṃ manaḥ //🔽pravaro 'ham ito na manyase 'tyavaro 'ham ito na manyase /
analyzed: ṛṣibhiḥ ca sadā mahātmabhiḥ na ca te vikriyate sthiram manaḥ  pravaraḥ ham itas na manyase tyavaraḥ ham itas na manyase
translated: And by the great sages, your mind remains firm, not agitated.

original: sadṛśo 'ham ito na manyase trividhā mānavidhā na santi te //
analyzed: sadṛśaḥ ham itas na manyase trividhāḥ māna vidhāḥ na santi te
translated: You do not think I am superior to this one, nor I am inferior to this one, nor I am equal to this one. The three kinds of pride do not exist in you.
You are patient, to you a clod of earth, a stone, and a piece of gold are the same.

original: tṛṇakāṣṭhasamaṃ mahāmune carasīdaṃ hi sadevakaṃ jagat //
analyzed: tṛṇa kāṣṭha samam mahā mune carasi idam hi sa devakam jagat
translated: To you, O Great Sage, this world with its gods is like grass and wood.

analyzed: hima bhāskara raśmi saṃgamāt śiśira uṣṇam pavanam samudvahan
translated: You bear the cold and hot winds that arise from the union of the rays of the sun and moon,

original: adhivāsayase nagendravan na ca te pravyathate sthiraṃ manaḥ //
analyzed: adhivāsayase naga indra vat na ca te pravyathate sthiram manaḥ
translated: Like the lord of mountains, and your firm mind is not disturbed.

analyzed: śayana āsana pāna bhojanam vividham cīvaram uttara adharam
translated: You direct to those in need bedding, seats, drinks, foods, various robes, upper and lower garments,

original: idam arthikato nideśase pratisaṃkhyāya mune nirāsravam //
analyzed: idam arthikataḥ nideśase pratisaṃkhyāya mune nirāsravam
translated: Having considered them, O Sage, with your stainless wisdom.

original: na ca śocasi nātha nāsti me na ca te santi mune parigrahāḥ /
analyzed: na ca śocasi nātha na asti me na ca te santi mune parigrahāḥ
translated: You do not grieve, O Lord, thinking This is not mine or These are not mine, O Sage, you have no possessions.

analyzed: asitaḥ si su vākya nirmamaḥ parimuktaḥ vividhaiḥ upadravaiḥ
translated: You are dark, O good speaker, free from possessiveness, completely liberated from various calamities.

original: na ca lābham avāpya hṛṣyase tadalābhāc ca layaṃ na gacchasi /
analyzed: na ca lābham avāpya hṛṣyase tad alābhāt ca layam na gacchasi
translated: You do not rejoice upon obtaining gain, nor do you become depressed due to its loss.

original: avamānam atho titikṣase na ca saṃmānam ihābhinandasi //
analyzed: avamānam atho titikṣase na ca saṃmānam iha abhinandasi
translated: You endure disrespect, and you do not delight in honor here.

analyzed: kṣataja upamam agra candanam sura bhū mandara sānu sambhavam
translated: The best sandalwood, which is like blood, and the fragrant scent arising from the Mandara mountain,

original: asayo niśitāḥ śarāś ca te na vikurvanti manaḥ kadācana //
analyzed: asayaḥ niśitāḥ śarāḥ ca te na vikurvanti manaḥ kadācana
translated: The sharp weapons and arrows never affect your mind at all.

original: na kathāṃ kathayasy anarthikāṃ na ca yā durjanasevitā kathā /
analyzed: na kathām kathayasi anarthikām na ca yā durjana sevitā kathā
translated: You do not tell meaningless stories, nor stories that are frequented by the wicked,

original: na ca lābhakathā na sāmiṣā na ca yā nānumatā mahātmabhiḥ //
analyzed: na ca lābha kathā na sa āmiṣā na ca yā na anumatā mahātmabhiḥ
translated: Nor stories about gain or about meat, nor stories that are not approved by the great ones.

original: pravivekakathāḥ sukhāvahāḥ praśamaṃ yāḥ pravadanti kevalam /
analyzed: praviveka kathāḥ sukha āvahāḥ praśamam yāḥ pravadanti kevalam
translated: The discourses on seclusion are delightful, which lead solely to tranquility.

original: kathayasy atidevatāḥ kathāḥ kathitā yā vinayanti kilviṣam //
analyzed: kathayasi atidevatāḥ kathāḥ kathitāḥ yāḥ vinayanti kilviṣam
translated: You tell the stories of the gods, which are said to restrain sin.

original: madhurāṇi ca saṅgatāni ca svabhinītāni ca sāravanti ca /
analyzed: madhurāṇi ca saṅgatāni ca su abhinītāni ca sāravanti ca
translated: Sweet, coherent, well-composed, and substantial,

original: vacanāni mune prabhāṣase jagadarthāya viniścitāni ca //
analyzed: vacanāni mune prabhāṣase jagat arthāya viniścitāni ca
translated: The sage speaks words for the sake of the world, and they are well-determined.

analyzed: abudhāḥ viparīta darśanāḥ capalāḥ sāhasikāḥ priya anvitāḥ
translated: The ignorant, those with distorted views, the fickle, the rash, those attached to loved ones,

original: piśunāḥ paruṣāḥ śaṭhāś ca ye bhagavaṃs taiḥ saha saṅgataṃ na te //
analyzed: piśunāḥ paruṣāḥ śaṭhāḥ ca ye bhagavan taiḥ saha saṅgatam na te
translated: The slanderers, the harsh, and the deceitful - you do not associate with them, O Blessed One.

original: aśaṭhā ṛjavaś ca ye narāḥ śucayaḥ satyaratā jitendriyāḥ /
analyzed: a śaṭhāḥ ṛjavaḥ ca ye narāḥ śucayaḥ satya ratāḥ jita indriyāḥ
translated: But those who are honest, upright, pure, devoted to truth, and self-controlled,

original: satataṃ ca samīkṣyakāriṇo bhagavaṃs taiḥ saha saṅgataṃ tava //🔽dharmajña nayajña pudgalajña tvāṃ vande ṣaḍabhijña sarvadaiva /
analyzed: satatam ca samīkṣyakāriṇaḥ bhagavan taiḥ saha saṅgatam tava  dharma jña naya jña pudgala jña tvām vande ṣaḍabhijña sarvadā eva
translated: And always act after careful consideration - with them, O Blessed One, you associate.🔽O knower of Dharma, knower of right conduct, knower of individuals, I always pay homage to you, O one with the six higher knowledges.

original: kṣetrajña mune parāparajña tvāṃ vande śirasā nayānayajña //
analyzed: kṣetrajña mune para apara jña tvām vande śirasā naya anaya jña
translated: O knower of fields, sage, knower of the highest and the next highest, I pay homage to you with my head, O knower of right and wrong conduct.

original: pṛthum api samīkṣate guṇaṃ tava parikathito hi mayā guṇaikadeśaḥ /🔽fol / GBM /
analyzed: pṛthum api samīkṣate guṇam tava parikathitaḥ hi mayā guṇa eka deśaḥ 🔽ro-0
translated: Even a great virtue of yours is seen, for a part of your virtue has been described by me.

original: na tava guṇamahārṇavasya pāraṃ jagati pumān adhigantum ārya śaktaḥ //
analyzed: na tava guṇa mahā arṇavasya pāram jagati pumān adhigantum ārya śaktaḥ
translated: No one in the world, noble one, is able to reach the other shore of the ocean of your great qualities.

original: ity evamādibhiḥ pañcabhiḥ stotraśatair bhagavān abhiṣṭutaḥ MS abhituṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: iti evamādibhiḥ pañcabhiḥ stotra śataiḥ bhagavān abhiṣṭutaḥ abhituṣṭaḥ
translated: Thus the Blessed One was praised with these and other five hundred hymns, and was satisfied.

original: tathābhiprasannasya ca bhagavatā nīlabhūter dharmo deśitaḥ /
analyzed: tathā abhiprasannasya ca bhagavatā nīlabhūteḥ dharmaḥ deśitaḥ
translated: And when he was thus pleased, the Blessed One taught the Dharma to Nīlabhūti.

original: yathā yathā tasminn evāsane niṣaṇṇena satyadarśanaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: yathā yathā tasmin eva āsane niṣaṇṇena satya darśanam kṛtam
translated: Just as he sat there, he saw the truths.

original: atha nīlabhūtir brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṃ stutvā prakrāntaḥ /
analyzed: atha nīlabhūtiḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam stutvā prakrāntaḥ
translated: Then the brahmin Nīlabhūti, having praised the Blessed One, departed.

analyzed: saḥ dhva pratipannaḥ māthuryaiḥ brāhmaṇaiḥ saṃcamparīkṛtaḥ
translated: While traveling, he was criticized by the Māthura brahmins.

analyzed: upādhyāya tvam asmābhiḥ abhihitaḥ
translated: Preceptor, we told you:

analyzed: śramaṇasya gautamasya asatkāram kuruṣva iti
translated: 'Do not treat the ascetic Gautama with disrespect.'

analyzed: sa tvam etarhi stutvā āgataḥ
translated: But now you have come back after praising him.

original: bhavanto na tv ahaṃ pūrvam avocam /
analyzed: bhavantaḥ na tu aham pūrvam avocam
translated: Sirs, I did not say that before.

analyzed: mama jihvā satya abhidhāyinī  yadi ākrośa arhaḥ bhaviṣyati  ākrośe
translated: My tongue speaks the truth.🔽If he is worthy of abuse,🔽I will abuse him.

analyzed: stava arhaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: If he is worthy of praise,

analyzed: stoṣye iti
translated: I will praise him.

analyzed: stava arhaḥ śramaṇaḥ gautamaḥ mayā stutaḥ
translated: The ascetic Gautama, who is worthy of praise, has been praised by me.

original: atha bhagavān pūrvāhṇe nivāsya pātracīvaram ādāya mathurāṃ piṇḍāya prāvikṣat /
analyzed: atha bhagavān pūrvāhṇe nivāsya pātra cīvaram ādāya mathurām piṇḍāya prāvikṣat
translated: Then the Blessed One, having dressed in the morning, took his bowl and robe and entered Mathurā for alms.

original: tena khalu samayena mathurāyāṃ nakṣatrarātraḥ pratyupasthitaḥ /
analyzed: tena khalu samayena mathurāyām nakṣatra rātraḥ pratyupasthitaḥ
translated: At that time in Mathurā, the Nakṣatra festival had arrived.

original: atha yā devatā mathurāyām adhyuṣitā tasyā etad abhavat /
analyzed: atha yā devatā mathurāyām adhyuṣitā tasyāḥ etat abhavat
translated: Then the deity who was residing in Mathurā thought this:

analyzed: yadi śramaṇaḥ gautamaḥ mathurām pravekṣyati
translated: If the ascetic Gautama enters Mathurā,

original: mama nakṣatrarātrer antarāyaṃ kariṣyatīti viditvā bhagavataḥ purastād vinagno 'sthāt /
analyzed: mama nakṣatra rātreḥ antarāyam kariṣyati iti viditvā bhagavataḥ purastāt vinagnaḥ sthāt
translated: he will create an obstacle for my Nakṣatra festival. Knowing this, she stood naked in front of the Blessed One.

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: apraticchannas tāvad devate mātṛgrāmo na śobhate prāg eva vinagna iti /
analyzed: a praticchannaḥ tāvat devate mātṛgrāmaḥ na śobhate prāk eva vinagnaḥ iti
translated: A woman, O deity, is not beautiful even when covered, let alone naked.

original: atha sā devatā jihrīya nagnarūpā ekānte 'pakrāntā /
analyzed: atha sā devatā jihrīya nagna rūpā ekānte pakrāntā
translated: Then that deity, ashamed, went away to one side in her naked form.

original: tato bhagavān mārgād apakramya purastād bhikṣusaṃghasya prajñapta evāsane niṣaṇṇaḥ /
analyzed: tatas bhagavān mārgāt apakramya purastāt bhikṣu saṃghasya prajñapte eva āsane niṣaṇṇaḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One, having left the road, sat down on the seat prepared in front of the assembly of monks.

analyzed: niṣadya bhagavān bhikṣūn āmantrayate sma
translated: Having sat down, the Blessed One addressed the monks:

analyzed: pañca ime bhikṣavaḥ ādīnavāḥ mathurāyām
translated: Monks, there are these five dangers in Mathurā.

analyzed: katame pañca
translated: What are the five?

analyzed: utkūla nikūlāḥ sthāṇu kaṇṭaka pradhānāḥ
translated: Uneven, with stumps and thorns predominant,

analyzed: bahu pāṣāṇa śarkara kaṭhallāḥ uccandra bhaktāḥ pracura mātṛgrāmāḥ iti
translated: with many stones, pebbles, and gravel, with a high proportion of women, and with a multitude of Mātṛs.

original: atha bahagavān na praviśann eva mathurāṃ yena gardabhasya yakṣasya bhavanaṃ tenopasaṃkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: atha bahagavān na praviśan eva mathurām yena gardabhasya yakṣasya bhavanam tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One, not entering Mathurā at all, approached the abode of the yakṣa Gardabha.

original: upasaṃkramya gardabhasya yakṣasya bhavanam abhyavagāhyānyatarad vṛkṣamūlaṃ niśritya niṣaṇṇo divāvihārāya /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya gardabhasya yakṣasya bhavanam abhyavagāhya anyatarat vṛkṣa mūlam niśritya niṣaṇṇaḥ divāvihārāya
translated: Having approached, he entered the abode of the yakṣa Gardabha and sat down leaning against the root of a certain tree to spend the day.

original: aśrauṣur māthurā brāhmaṇagṛhapatayo bhagavān piṇḍāya prāviśat devatayā viheṭhitaḥ /
analyzed: aśrauṣuḥ māthurāḥ brāhmaṇa gṛhapatayaḥ bhagavān piṇḍāya prāviśat devatayā viheṭhitaḥ
translated: The brāhmaṇas and householders of Mathurā heard that the Blessed One entered for alms but was obstructed by a deity.

original: apraviśann eva mathurāṃ gardabhasya yakṣasya bhavanaṃ gata iti śrutvā ca punaḥ śucinaḥ
analyzed: a praviśan eva mathurām gardabhasya yakṣasya bhavanam gataḥ iti śrutvā ca punar śucinaḥ
translated: Having heard that he went to the abode of the yakṣa Gardabha without entering Mathurā at all, and having heard that, they again prepared pure,

original: praṇītasya khādanīyabhojanīyasya pratyekaṃ pratyekaṃ sthālīpākaṃ samudānīya śakaṭe🔽āropya yena bhagavāṃs tenopasaṃkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: praṇītasya khādanīya bhojanīyasya pratyekam pratyekam sthālīpākam samudānīya śakaṭe  āropya yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: excellent food and drink, each one a pot of cooked food, loaded it on a cart,🔽and approached the Blessed One.

original: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvaikānte niṣaṇṇaḥ /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā ekānte niṣaṇṇaḥ
translated: Having approached, they bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One and sat down to one side.

original: ekāntaniṣaṇṇān śrāddhān māthurān brāhmaṇagṛhapatīn bhagavān dharmyayā kathayā pūrvavad yāvat saṃpraharṣya tūṣṇīm /
analyzed: ekānta niṣaṇṇān śrāddhān māthurān brāhmaṇa gṛhapatīn bhagavān dharmyayā kathayā pūrvavat yāvat saṃpraharṣya tūṣṇīm
translated: The Blessed One, with a Dharma talk as before, delighted the faithful Māthura brahmins and householders who were sitting in one place, and then remained silent.

original: atha śrāddhā brāhmaṇagṛhapataya utthāyāsanād ekāṃsam uttarāsaṅgaṃ kṛtvā yena bhagavāṃs tenāñjaliṃ praṇamya bhagavantam idam avocat /
analyzed: atha śrāddhāḥ brāhmaṇa gṛhapatayaḥ utthāya āsanāt eka aṃsam uttarāsaṅgam kṛtvā yena bhagavān tena añjalim praṇamya bhagavantam idam avocat
translated: Then the faithful brahmins and householders, having risen from their seats, arranged their upper robes over one shoulder, made the gesture of supplication to the Blessed One, and said this to the Blessed One:

original: ihāsmābhir bhadanta bhagavantam uddiśya śucinaḥ praṇītasya khādanīyabhojanīyasya śakaṭaṃ pūrṇam ānītam /
analyzed: iha asmābhiḥ bhadanta bhagavantam uddiśya śucinaḥ praṇītasya khādanīya bhojanīyasya śakaṭam pūrṇam ānītam
translated: Here, Venerable One, we have brought a full cart of pure, excellent food and drink for the Blessed One.

original: tad bhagavān pratigṛhṇātu anukampām upādāya iti /
analyzed: tat bhagavān pratigṛhṇātu anukampām upādāya iti
translated: May the Blessed One accept it out of compassion.

original: tatra bhagavān ānandam āyuṣmantam āmantrayate /🔽gacchānanda yāvanto bhikṣavo gardabhasya yakṣasya bhavanam fol / GBM /🔽upaniśritya MSV I
analyzed: tatra bhagavān ānandam āyuṣmantam āmantrayate  gaccha ānanda yāvantaḥ bhikṣu gardabha yakṣa bhavana  upaniśritya
translated: There the Blessed One addressed the venerable Ānanda:🔽Go, Ānanda, and assemble all the monks who are staying in the vicinity of the Yakṣa Gardabha's abode

analyzed: viharanti tān sarvān upasthānaśālāyām sannipātaya
translated: in the assembly hall.

analyzed: paribhokṣyante piṇḍapātam iti
translated: They will eat the alms-food.

original: evaṃ bhadanta ity āyuṣmān ānando bhagavataḥ pratiśrutya yāvanto bhikṣavo gardabhasya
analyzed: evam bhadanta iti āyuṣmān ānandaḥ bhagavataḥ pratiśrutya yāvantaḥ bhikṣavaḥ gardabhasya
translated: Yes, Venerable Sir, the Venerable Ānanda replied, consenting to the Blessed One. He went to the monks who were staying in the Sattapaṇṇi Cave and said this:

original: yakṣasya bhavanam upaniśritya viharanti tān sarvān upasthānaśālāyāṃ sannipātya yena
analyzed: yakṣasya bhavanam upaniśritya viharanti tān sarvān upasthānaśālāyām sannipātya yena
translated: Thus, Venerable One, the Venerable Ānanda, having assented to the Blessed One, having assembled all the monks who were staying in the vicinity of the Yakṣa Gardabha's abode in the assembly hall,

analyzed: bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: approached the Blessed One.

analyzed: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā ekānte sthāt
translated: Having approached, he bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One and stood to one side.

original: ekāntasthita āyuṣmān ānando bhagavantam idam avocat /
analyzed: ekānta sthitaḥ āyuṣmān ānandaḥ bhagavantam idam avocat
translated: Standing to one side, the Venerable Ānanda said this to the Blessed One:

original: yāvanto bhadanta bhikṣavo gardabhasya yakṣasya bhavanam upaniśritya viharanti sarve te upasthānaśālāyāṃ sanniṣaṇṇāḥ sannipatitāḥ /
analyzed: yāvantaḥ bhadanta bhikṣavaḥ gardabhasya yakṣasya bhavanam upaniśritya viharanti sarve te upasthānaśālāyām sanniṣaṇṇāḥ sannipatitāḥ
translated: All the monks, Venerable One, who are staying in the vicinity of the Yakṣa Gardabha's abode, they are all seated and assembled in the assembly hall.

analyzed: yasya idānīm bhagavān kālam manyate iti
translated: Now, Venerable One, if you think it is the right time.

analyzed: atha bhagavān yena upasthānaśālā tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One approached the assembly hall.

original: upasaṃkramya purastād bhikṣusaṃghasya prajñapta evāsane niṣaṇṇaḥ /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya purastāt bhikṣu saṃghasya prajñapte eva āsane niṣaṇṇaḥ
translated: Having approached, he sat down on the seat prepared in front of the community of monks.

analyzed: atha māthurāḥ śrāddhāḥ brāhmaṇa gṛhapatayaḥ sukha upaniṣaṇṇam
translated: Then the faithful brahmin householders of Mathurā, seeing that the Blessed One was seated at ease,

original: buddhapramukhaṃ bhikṣusaṃghaṃ viditvā pūrvavad yāvad dhautahastam apanītapātraṃ bhagavataḥ purastāt tasthur āyācamānaṃ cāhuḥ /
analyzed: buddha pramukham bhikṣu saṃgham viditvā pūrvavat yāvat dhauta hastam apanīta pātram bhagavataḥ purastāt tasthuḥ āyācamānam ca āhuḥ
translated: Knowing that the Buddha and the community of monks were finished eating, as before, after washing their hands and putting away their bowls, they stood in front of the Blessed One, asking for a favor.

original: bhagavatā bhadanta te te duṣṭanāgā duṣṭayakṣāś ca vinītāḥ /
analyzed: bhagavatā bhadanta te te duṣṭa nāgāḥ duṣṭa yakṣāḥ ca vinītāḥ
translated: Blessed One, those evil nāgas and evil yakṣas have been subdued by you, Blessed One.

original: ayaṃ bhadanta gardabhako yakṣo 'smākaṃ dīrgharātram avairiṇāṃ vairī /🔽asapatnānāṃ sapatnaḥ /🔽adrugdhānāṃ drogdhā /
analyzed: ayam bhadanta gardabhakaḥ yakṣaḥ smākam dīrgharātram avairiṇām vairī  asapatnānām sapatnaḥ  a drugdhānām drogdhā
translated: But, Blessed One, this yakṣa named Gardabha has been our enemy for a long time, even though we are not his enemies.🔽He is the enemy of those who have no enemies.🔽He is the one who harms those who do no harm.

analyzed: jātāni jātāni apatyāni apaharati
translated: He steals the newly born children.

original: aho vata bhagavān gardabhakaṃ yakṣaṃ vinayed anukampām upādāyeti /

original: tato bhagavatā tasyā āśayānuśayaṃ dhātuṃ prakṛtiṃ ca jñatvā tādṛśī cāturāryasatyasaṃprativedhikī
analyzed: tatas bhagavatā tasyāḥ āśaya anuśayam dhātum prakṛtim ca jñatvā tādṛśī cātura ārya satya saṃprativedhikī
translated: Then the Blessed One, having known her disposition, propensities, temperament, and nature, taught the Dharma that was appropriate for that, which was good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with its own meaning, with its own phrasing, pure, complete, and purified.

original: dharmadeśanā kṛtā yāṃ śrutvā kacaṃgalayā viṃśatiśikharasamudgataṃ satkāyadṛṣṭiśailaṃ
analyzed: dharma deśanā kṛtā yām śrutvā kacaṃgalayā viṃśati śikhara samudgatam satkāyadṛṣṭi śailam
translated: She taught the Dharma, hearing which Kacaṅgalā shattered with the thunderbolt of wisdom the twenty-peak mountain of the view of the transitory collection,

analyzed: jñāna vajreṇa bhitvā srotāpatti phalam sākṣātkṛtam
translated: and actualized the fruit of stream-entry.

analyzed: sā dṛṣṭa satyā tris udānam udānayati
translated: Having seen the truths, she exclaimed three times:🔽Reverend, this was not done by my mother,

original: idam asmākaṃ bhadanta na mātrā kṛtaṃ na pitrā /🔽pūrvavad yāvat /
analyzed: idam asmākam bhadanta na mātrā kṛtam na pitrā  pūrvavat yāvat
translated: nor by my father,🔽nor by a king, nor by gods, nor by ascetics and brahmins.

original: anādyakālopacitaṃ satkāyadṛṣṭiśailaṃ jñānavajreṇa bhitvā srotāpattiphalaṃ sākṣātkṛtam /
analyzed: anādya kāla upacitam satkāyadṛṣṭi śailam jñāna vajreṇa bhitvā srotāpatti phalam sākṣātkṛtam
translated: Having shattered with the thunderbolt of wisdom the mountain of the view of the transitory collection accumulated since beginningless time, I have actualized the fruit of stream-entry.

analyzed: gāthām ca bhāṣate
translated: And she spoke this verse:

analyzed: yat kartavyam su putreṇa mātā anugraha kāriṇā
translated: What a good son should do to benefit his mother,

original: tat kṛtaṃ bhavatā me 'dya cittaṃ mokṣaparāyaṇam //
analyzed: tat kṛtam bhavatā me dya cittam mokṣa parāyaṇam
translated: that you have done for me today, turning my mind to liberation.

original: durgatibhyaḥ samuddhṛtya svarge mokṣe ca te aham /
analyzed: durgatibhyaḥ samuddhṛtya svarge mokṣe ca te aham
translated: Having lifted me out of the lower realms, you have placed me with great effort in heaven and liberation.

original: sthāpitā suprayatnena sādhu te duṣkaraṃ kṛtam //🔽ity uktvā bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā bhagavato 'ntikāt prakrāntā /
analyzed: sthāpitā su prayatnena sādhu te duṣkaram kṛtam  iti uktvā bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā bhagavataḥ ntikāt prakrāntā
translated: Well done, you have done what is difficult.🔽Having said this, she bowed her head at the Blessed One's feet and departed from the Blessed One's presence.

original: atha kacaṃgalā apareṇa samayena svāminam anujñāpya yena bhagavāṃs tenopasaṃkrāntā /
analyzed: atha kacaṃgalā apareṇa samayena svāminam anujñāpya yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāntā
translated: Then Kacaṅgalā, having obtained permission from her husband at a later time, approached the Blessed One.

original: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā ekānte niṣaṇṇā /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā ekānte niṣaṇṇā
translated: Having approached, she bowed her head at the feet of the Blessed One and sat to one side.

analyzed: ekānta niṣaṇṇā kacaṃgalā bhagavantam idam avocat
translated: While sitting to one side, Kacaṅgalā said this to the Blessed One:

original: labheyāhaṃ bhadanta svākhyāte dharmavinaye pravrajyām upasaṃpadaṃ bhikṣuṇībhāvaṃ careyam ahaṃ bhagavato fol / GBM /🔽'ntike brahmacaryam iti /
analyzed: labheya aham bhadanta su  ākhyāte dharma vinaye pravrajyām upasaṃpadam bhikṣuṇī bhāvam careyam mad SN bhagavataḥ  ntike brahmacaryam iti
translated: Venerable One, may I receive the going forth, full ordination, and the state of a nun in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya? May I practice the holy life in the presence of the Blessed One?

analyzed: bhagavatā mahāprajāpatye saṃnyastā
translated: The Blessed One entrusted her to Mahāprajāpatī.

original: tatas tayā pravrājitā upasaṃpāditā avavādo dattaḥ /
analyzed: tatas tayā pravrājitā upasaṃpāditā avavādaḥ dattaḥ
translated: Then she was sent forth and fully ordained by her, and instruction was given.

original: tayā yujyamānayā ghaṭamānayā vyāyacchamānayā sarvakleśaprahāṇād arhatvaṃ sākṣātkṛtam /
analyzed: tayā yujyamānayā ghaṭamānayā vyāyacchamānayā sarva kleśa prahāṇāt arha tvam sākṣātkṛtam
translated: By one who is striving, exerting, and endeavoring, she realized arhatship through the complete abandonment of all defilements.

analyzed: arhantinī ca babhūva
translated: And she became an arhat.

original: traidhātukavītarāgā pūrvavan mānyā ca saṃvṛttā /🔽yadā bhagavān bhikṣuṇīnāṃ saṃkṣepeṇoddiśya vihāraṃ praviśati pratisaṃlayanāya tadā taṃ kacaṃgalā vistareṇa vyākaroti /
analyzed: traidhātuka vīta rāgā pūrvavat mānyā ca saṃvṛttā  yadā bhagavān bhikṣuṇīnām saṃkṣepeṇa uddiśya vihāram praviśati pratisaṃlayanāya tadā tam kacaṃgalā vistareṇa vyākaroti
translated: She became free from desire for the three realms, and as before, she became one to be respected.🔽When the Blessed One, having instructed the nuns briefly, entered the dwelling for seclusion, then Kacaṅgalā explained it in detail.🔽There the Blessed One addressed the monks:

analyzed: tatra bhagavān bhikṣūn āmantrayate sma
translated: Monks, this Kacaṅgalā,

original: eṣāgrā me bhikṣavo bhikṣuṇīnāṃ mama śrāvikāṇāṃ sūtrāntavibhāgakartrīṇāṃ yaduta kacaṃgalā bhikṣuṇī iti /
analyzed: eṣā agrā me bhikṣavaḥ bhikṣuṇīnām mama śrāvikāṇām sūtrānta vibhāga kartrīṇām yat uta kacaṃgalā bhikṣuṇī iti
translated: This is the best of my nuns who are my disciples, the compilers of the sutra divisions, namely the nun Kacangalā.

original: bhikṣavaḥ saṃśayajātāḥ sarvasaṃśayacchettāraṃ buddhaṃ bhagavantaṃ papracchuḥ /
analyzed: bhikṣavaḥ saṃśaya jātāḥ sarva saṃśaya chettāram buddham bhagavantam papracchuḥ
translated: The monks, being doubtful, asked the Blessed One, the Buddha, who removes all doubts:

original: kiṃ bhadanta kacaṃgalāyāḥ karma kṛtaṃ yena vṛddhā pravrajitā /
analyzed: kim bhadanta kacaṃgalāyāḥ karma kṛtam yena vṛddhā pravrajitā
translated: Venerable sir, what deed did Kacangalā do that she became a nun in old age?

original: kiṃ ca karma kṛtaṃ yena daridrā dāsī ca saṃvṛttā bhagavāṃś ca paścimena garbhavāsena dhāritaḥ /
analyzed: kim ca karma kṛtam yena daridrā dāsī ca saṃvṛttā bhagavān ca paścimena garbha vāsena dhāritaḥ
translated: And what deed did she do that she became poor, a slave, and carried the Blessed One in her womb for the last time?

analyzed: pravrajyā arha tvam ca sākṣātkṛtam
translated: And that she went forth, realized arhatship,

analyzed: bhagavatā ca sūtrānta vibhāga kartrīṇām agrā nirdiṣṭā iti
translated: and was declared by the Blessed One to be the best of those who compile the sutra divisions?

analyzed: bhagavān āha  kacaṃgalayā eva i
translated: The Blessed One said:🔽By Kacangalā herself, monks,🔽in the past, deeds were done, accumulated,

original: bhikṣavo bhikṣuṇyā karmāṇi kṛtāny upacitāni labdhasaṃbhārāṇi pūrvavad yāvat phalanti khalu dehinām /
analyzed: bhikṣavaḥ bhikṣuṇyā karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni labdha saṃbhārāṇi pūrvavat yāvat phalanti khalu dehinām
translated: and stored up, as explained before, and they ripened upon her, as deeds do for embodied beings.

original: bhūtapūrvaṃ bhikṣavo bodhisatvacaryāyāṃ vartamānasya eṣā mama mātā babhūva /
analyzed: bhūta pūrvam bhikṣavaḥ bodhisatva caryāyām vartamānasya eṣā mama mātā babhūva
translated: Monks, in the past, when I was practicing the conduct of a bodhisattva, she was my mother.

original: yadāhaṃ pravrajitum icchāmi tadā mām eva vārayati /
analyzed: yadā aham pravrajitum icchāmi tadā mām eva vārayati
translated: When I wanted to go forth, she prevented me.

analyzed: tasya karmaṇaḥ vipākena vṛddhā pravrajitā
translated: As a result of that action, she became old and went forth.

analyzed: dānam dadataḥ me nayā dāna antarāyaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: When I was giving a gift, she created an obstacle to my generosity.

analyzed: tena daridrā saṃvṛttā
translated: Because of that, she became poor.

original: na cānayā puṇyamaheśākhyasaṃvartanīyāni karmāṇi kṛtāni yathā mahāmāyayā yenāham anayā paścime garbhavāsena dhāritaḥ /
analyzed: na ca anayā puṇya maheśākhya saṃvartanīyāni karmāṇi kṛtāni yathā mahāmāyayā yena aham anayā paścime garbha vāsena dhāritaḥ
translated: But she did not perform actions that would lead to great merit and fame, as did Mahāmayā, by whom I was carried in my last existence in the womb.

original: kāśyape ca samyaksaṃbuddhe pravrajitā yāḥ śaikṣāśaikṣā bhikṣuṇyo dāsīvādena samudācaritāḥ /
analyzed: kāśyape ca samyaksaṃbuddhe pravrajitāḥ yāḥ śaikṣa aśaikṣāḥ bhikṣuṇyaḥ dāsī vādena samudācaritāḥ
translated: And in the presence of the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa, she went forth as a nun, and addressed the nuns who were training and had completed training as slaves.

analyzed: tena dāsī saṃvṛttā
translated: Because of that, she became a slave.

original: yat tatrānayā paṭhitaṃ svādhyāyitaṃ skandhakauśalaṃ dhātukauśalam āyatanakauśalaṃ
analyzed: yat tatra anayā paṭhitam svādhyāyitam skandha kauśalam dhātu kauśalam āyatana kauśalam
translated: Whatever she recited there, studied, and practiced skill in the aggregates, skill in the elements, skill in the sense bases,

analyzed: pratītyasamutpāda kauśalam sthāna asthāna kauśalam ca kṛtam tena mama śāsane pravrajya
translated: skill in dependent origination, and skill in what is possible and impossible, by that she went forth in my teaching

analyzed: sarva kleśa prahāṇāt arha tvam sākṣātkṛtam
translated: and realized arhatship through the complete abandonment of all defilements.

original: yasyāś copādhyāyikāyāḥ sakāśe pravrajitā sā bhagavatā kāśyapena samyaksaṃbuddhena sūtrāntavibhāgakartrīṇām agrā nirdiṣṭā /

translated: And the preceptor nun in whose presence she went forth was declared by the Blessed One, the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa, as the foremost of those who divide the sūtras.

original: tatrānayā maraṇakālasamaye praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ yan mayā bhagavati kāśyape samyaksaṃbuddhe anuttare dakṣiṇīye yāvad āyur brahmacaryaṃ caritaṃ
analyzed: tatra anayā maraṇa kāla samaye praṇidhānam kṛtam yat mayā bhagavati kāśyape samyaksaṃbuddhe anuttare dakṣiṇīye yāvat āyuḥ brahmacaryam caritam  /
translated: At that time, at the moment of death, he made this aspiration: 'Although I have practiced celibacy for as long as I lived under the Blessed One, the perfect and complete Buddha Kāśyapa, the unsurpassed recipient of offerings,

analyzed: na ca kaścid guṇa gaṇaḥ dhigataḥ
translated: and have not attained any multitude of virtues,

analyzed: anena kuśala mūlena yaḥ sau bhagavatā kāśyapena uttaraḥ nāma māṇavaḥ vyākṛtaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: by this root of merit, may I, as predicted by the Blessed One Kāśyapa,

analyzed: tasya aham śāsane pravrajeyam
translated: May I go forth in his teaching.

original: MSV I yathaiṣā me upādhyāyikā bhagavatā kāśyapena samyaksaṃbuddhena sūtrāntavibhāgakartrīṇām agrā nirdiṣṭā /

translated: Just as my preceptor has been declared by the Blessed One, the perfect and complete Buddha Kāśyapa, as the foremost of those who divide the sūtras,

analyzed: evam  mām mad SA api  asu SNM bhagavant SNM śākyamuni SNM sūtra Cp vibhāga vibhāga Cp kartṛ PGF agra SAF nirdiś SPr3O iti

analyzed: tat praṇidhāna vaśāt etarhi mayā sūtrānta vibhāga kartrīṇām agrā nirdiṣṭā

analyzed: āgamaya ānanda yena vairaṃbhyam iti

analyzed: atha bhagavān saṃprasthitaḥ yāvat anyatamasmin ārāme

analyzed: ārāmam sektum ārabdhaḥ
translated: He had started to water the grove.

analyzed: adrākṣīt sa brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam dūrāt eva
translated: That brahmin saw the Blessed One from a distance.

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca punar saṃlakṣayati
translated: And having seen him, he thought:

analyzed: yadi śramaṇaḥ gautamaḥ ārāmam pravekṣyati  ārāmām udapānam sa dūṣayati iti

analyzed: i āgacchatu bhagavan gautama

analyzed: iyam rajjuḥ idam tipyakam
translated: This is the rope, this is the water pot.

analyzed: gṛhṇātu pānīyam yathāsukham iti
translated: Take the water as you like.

original: atha bhagavāṃs tasyāṃ velāyāṃ gāthāṃ bhāṣate /
analyzed: atha bhagavān tasyām velāyām gāthām bhāṣate
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke this verse at that time:

analyzed: kim kuryāt udapānena āpaḥ ced sarvatas yadi
translated: What would one do with a well if water were everywhere?

analyzed: ehibhikṣukayā pravrājitaḥ

analyzed: ehi iti ca uktaḥ sa tathāgatena muṇḍaḥ ca saṃghāṭī parīta dehaḥ
translated: When the Tathāgata said Come! he was shaved, his body covered with the saṃghāṭī robe,

analyzed: sadyas praśānta indriyaḥ eva tasthau na eva sthitaḥ buddha manorathena 🔽tasthuḥ nepacchitā
translated: he immediately stood with his senses calm, not standing with the Buddha's intention.

analyzed: cf nepacchitā
translated: Cf. Nepacchimapravrajyā, fol.

original: tenodyacchamānena ghaṭamānena vyāyacchamānena sarvakleśaprahāṇād arhatvaṃ sākṣātkṛtam /
analyzed: tena udyacchamānena ghaṭamānena vyāyacchamānena sarva kleśa prahāṇāt arha tvam sākṣātkṛtam
translated: By him, striving, exerting, and endeavoring, through the abandonment of all defilements, arhatship was realized.

analyzed: arhan saṃvṛttaḥ
translated: He became an arhat.

original: traidhātukavītarāgaḥ pūrvavad yāvad abhivādyaś ca saṃvṛttaḥ /
analyzed: traidhātuka vīta rāgaḥ pūrvavat yāvat abhivādyaḥ ca saṃvṛttaḥ
translated: Free from passion for the three realms, as before, up to becoming worthy of offerings.
