translated: He was not able to clear his mind as before.

original: tato rājā buddhapramukhaṃ bhikṣusaṃghaṃ bhojayitvā na mama bhagavān nāmnā dakṣiṇām ādisatīti viditvā dakṣiṇām aśrutvaiva pradiṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: tatas rājā buddha pramukham bhikṣu saṃgham bhojayitvā na mama bhagavān nāmnā dakṣiṇām ādisati iti viditvā dakṣiṇām a śrutvā eva pradiṣṭaḥ
translated: Then the king, having fed the Buddha and the community of monks, knowing that the Blessed One was not dedicating the offering in his name, without hearing the dedication, departed.

original: tato bhagavatā rājñaḥ prasenajitaḥ kosalasya nāmnā evaṃ dakṣiṇādiṣṭā /🔽hastyaśvarathapattiyāyino bhuṃjānasya puraṃ sanaigamaṃ paśyasi /
analyzed: tatas bhagavatā rājñaḥ prasenajitaḥ kosalasya nāmnā evam dakṣiṇā ādiṣṭā  hasti aśva ratha patti yāyinaḥ bhuṃjānasya puram sa naigamam paśyasi
translated: Then the Blessed One dedicated the offering in the name of King Prasenajit of Kosala.🔽Do you see the city with its merchants and traders, while elephants, horses, chariots and infantry are eating?

original: balaṃ hi rūkṣikāyā alavaṇikāyāḥ kulmāsapiṇḍikāyāḥ // iti /
analyzed: balam hi rūkṣikāyāḥ a lavaṇikāyāḥ kulmāsa piṇḍikāyāḥ iti
translated: The strength of the coarse, unsalted ball of dough is great.

analyzed: atha āyuṣmān ānandaḥ bhagavantam avocat
translated: Then the Venerable Ānanda said to the Blessed One:

original: bahuśo bhadanta bhagavatā rājñaḥ prasenajitaḥ kosalasya niveśane bhuktvā nāmnā dakṣiṇā ādiṣṭā /
analyzed: bahuśas bhadanta bhagavatā rājñaḥ prasenajitaḥ kosalasya niveśane bhuktvā nāmnā dakṣiṇā ādiṣṭā
translated: 'Reverend, the Blessed One has eaten many times in the house of King Prasenajit of Kosala and dedicated the offering in his name.

analyzed: na abhijānāmi kadācid evaṃvidhām dakṣiṇām ādiṣṭa pūrvām
translated: I do not recall ever having heard such a dedication before.'

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:🔽'Ānanda,

original: icchasi tvam ānanda rājñaḥ prasenajitkosalasyālavaṇikāṃ kulmāsapiṇḍikām ārabhya karmaplotiṃ śrotum /
analyzed: icchasi tvam ānanda rājñaḥ prasenajit kosalasya a lavaṇikām kulmāsa piṇḍikām ārabhya karma plotim śrotum
translated: Do you wish to hear, Ānanda, the karmic bond of King Prasenajit of Kosala, beginning with the unsalted dumpling?

original: etasya bhagavan kālaḥ etasya sugata samayo yad bhagavān rājñaḥ prasenajitaḥ kosalasyālavaṇikāṃ kulmāsapiṇḍikām ārabhya karmaplotiṃ varṇayet
analyzed: etasya bhagavan kālaḥ etasya sugata samayaḥ yat bhagavān rājñaḥ prasenajitaḥ kosalasya a lavaṇikām kulmāsa piṇḍikām ārabhya karma plotim varṇayet
translated: This is the time, O Blessed One, this is the occasion, when the Blessed One would expound the karmic bond of King Prasenajit of Kosala, beginning with the unsalted dumpling.

original: bhagavataḥ śrutvā bhikṣavo dhārayiṣyantīti /🔽tatra bhagavān fol / GBM /
analyzed: bhagavataḥ śrutvā bhikṣavaḥ dhārayiṣyanti iti  tatra bhagavant
translated: Having heard it from the Blessed One, the monks will retain it.

analyzed: bhikṣūn āmantrayate sma
translated: There the Blessed One addressed the monks:

analyzed: bhūta pūrvam bhikṣavaḥ nyatasmin karvaṭake gṛhapatiḥ prativasati
translated: Monks, in the past, in a certain hill-fort, there lived a householder.

analyzed: tena sadṛśāt kulāt kalatram ānītam
translated: He took a wife from a family of equal standing.

original: sa tayā sārdhaṃ krīḍati ramate paricārayati /
analyzed: sa tayā sārdham krīḍati ramate paricārayati
translated: He played with her, made love to her, and enjoyed himself with her.

original: tasya krīḍato ramamāṇasya paricārayataḥ putro jātaḥ /
analyzed: tasya krīḍataḥ ramamāṇasya paricārayataḥ putraḥ jātaḥ
translated: While he was playing, making love, and enjoying himself, a son was born to him.

original: pūrvavad yāvad unnīto vardhito mahān saṃvṛttaḥ /
analyzed: pūrvavat yāvat unnītaḥ vardhitaḥ mahān saṃvṛttaḥ
translated: As before, he was brought up, nurtured, and grew up.

analyzed: yāvat asau gṛhapatiḥ patnīm āmantrayate
translated: Until that householder said to his wife:

analyzed: bhadre jātaḥ smākam ṛṇa haraḥ dhana haraḥ ca iti
translated: My dear, a son has been born to us who will repay debts and increase wealth.

analyzed: gacchāmi paṇyam ādāya deśa antaram iti
translated: “I’m going to another country to get goods.”

analyzed: sā kathayati ārya evam kuruṣva iti
translated: She said, “Noble one, do so.”

analyzed: sa paṇyam ādāya deśa antaram gataḥ
translated: He took goods and went to another country.

analyzed: tatra eva ca anayena vyasanam āpannaḥ lpa paricchedaḥ saḥ
translated: And there, through misfortune, he was reduced to a small amount of property.

analyzed: tasya gṛhe dhana jātam parikṣīṇam
translated: The wealth in his house was exhausted.

analyzed: saḥ sya putraḥ duḥkhitaḥ jātaḥ
translated: His son was born into suffering.

analyzed: tasya gṛhapateḥ vayasyakaḥ
translated: A friend of that householder

analyzed: sa tena uktaḥ
translated: said to him,

analyzed: mama api tvam putraḥ
translated: “You are also my son.

analyzed: mama kṣetram pratipālaya
translated: Take care of my field.

original: ahaṃ tava bhaktena yogodvahanaṃ karomīti /🔽sa tasya kṣetravyāpāraṃ kartum ārabdhaḥ /
analyzed: aham tava bhaktena yogodvahanam karomi iti  sa tasya kṣetra vyāpāram kartum ārabdhaḥ
translated: I will provide you with food and carry out the work.”🔽He began to manage the field for him.

analyzed: saḥ asya bhaktena yogodvahanam karoti
translated: And he provided him with food and carried out the work.

analyzed: yāvat apareṇa samayena parva pratyupasthitam
translated: Then, at another time, a festival arrived.

analyzed: tasya dārakasya mātā saṃlakṣayati
translated: The mother of that boy thought,

analyzed: adya gṛhapati patnī suhṛd saṃbandhi bāndhava śramaṇa bhojane vyagrā bhaviṣyati
translated: “Today the wife of the householder will be busy feeding her friends, relatives, and acquaintances.

original: gacchāmi sānukālaṃ tasya dārakasya bhaktaṃ nayāmīti /
analyzed: gacchāmi sa anukālam tasya dārakasya bhaktam nayāmi iti
translated: I will go and bring food to that boy at the right time.”

original: sā sānukālaṃ gatvā gṛhapatipatnyā etam arthaṃ nivedayati /
analyzed: sā sa anukālam gatvā gṛhapati patnyai etam artham nivedayati
translated: She went there in due course and informed the householder's wife of the matter.

analyzed: sā ruṣitā kathayati
translated: She, being angry, said:

analyzed: na tāvat śramaṇa brāhmaṇebhyaḥ dadāmi
translated: I do not give to ascetics and brahmins yet.

analyzed: jñātīnām vā tāvat preṣyasya dadāmi
translated: Or I give to my relatives or servants.

analyzed: adya tāvat tiṣṭhatu
translated: But let it be for today.

analyzed: śvas dviguṇam dāsyāmi iti
translated: Tomorrow I will give double.

analyzed: tatas tasya dārakasya mātā saṃlakṣayati
translated: Then the boy's mother thought:

analyzed: mā dārakaḥ bubhukṣitaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: May my son not go hungry.

analyzed: etām ātmīyām a lavaṇikām kulmāsa piṇḍikām nayāmi iti
translated: I will bring this unsalted ball of vetch for myself.

analyzed: sā tām ādāya kṣetram gatā
translated: She took it and went to the field.

original: putrasya vistareṇa yad gṛhapatnyābhihitaṃ tat sarvam ākhyāya kathayati /
analyzed: putrasya vistareṇa yat gṛha patnyā abhihitam tat sarvam ākhyāya kathayati
translated: Having told in detail everything that the householder's wife had said, she said:

original: iyaṃ mayā ātmīyā alavaṇikā kulmāsapiṇḍikā ānītā /
analyzed: iyam mayā ātmīyā a lavaṇikā kulmāsa piṇḍikā ānītā
translated: This is the unsalted ball of vetch for myself that I have brought.

analyzed: i etām paribhuṃkṣva iti
translated: Eat it.

analyzed: sa kathayati
translated: He said:

analyzed: sthāpayitvā gaccha iti
translated: Go away after putting it down.

analyzed: sā sthāpitvā prakrāntā
translated: She put it down and left.

original: asati buddhānām utpāde pratyekabuddhā loke utpadyante hīnadīnānukaṃpakāḥ prāntaśayanāsanabhaktā ekadakṣiṇīyā lokasya /
analyzed: asati buddhānām utpāde pratyekabuddhāḥ loke utpadyante hīna dīna anukaṃpakāḥ prānta śayanāsana bhaktāḥ eka dakṣiṇīyāḥ lokasya
translated: When the Buddhas do not appear, Pratyekabuddhas appear in the world, who are compassionate towards the lowly and wretched, who enjoy living in remote places, and are the world's sole recipients of offerings.

original: yāvad anyatamaḥ pratyekabuddhas taṃ pradeśam anuprāptaḥ /
analyzed: yāvat anyatamaḥ pratyekabuddhaḥ tam pradeśam anuprāptaḥ
translated: Then a certain solitary buddha arrived in that place.

analyzed: sa tena dṛṣṭaḥ
translated: He was seen by the poor man.

analyzed: kāya prāsādikaḥ citta prāsādikaḥ ca śānta īryāpatha vartī
translated: He was physically pleasing, mentally pleasing, and had a peaceful demeanor.

analyzed: sa saṃlakṣayati
translated: He thought,

original: nūnaṃ mayaivaṃvidhe sadbhūtadakṣiṇīye kārā na kṛtā /
analyzed: nūnam mayā evaṃvidhe sadbhūtadakṣiṇīye kārā na kṛtā
translated: Surely I have not done any service to such a true object of generosity.

analyzed: yena me īdṛśī samavasthā
translated: Because of that, I am in this state.

original: yady ayaṃ mamāntikād alavaṇikāṃ kulmāsapiṇḍikāṃ gṛhṇīyād aham asmai dadyām iti /
analyzed: yadi ayam mama antikāt a lavaṇikām kulmāsa piṇḍikām gṛhṇīyāt aham asmai dadyām iti
translated: If he would take from me a ball of dough without salt, I would give it to him.

original: tataḥ pratyekabuddhas tasya daridrapuruṣasya cetasā cittam ājñāya pātraṃ prasāritavān /
analyzed: tatas pratyekabuddhaḥ tasya daridra puruṣasya cetasā cittam ājñāya pātram prasāritavān
translated: Then the solitary buddha, knowing the mind of that poor man, extended his bowl.

original: sacet tava parityaktaṃ dīyatām asmin pātre iti /
analyzed: saced tava parityaktam dīyatām asmin pātre iti
translated: If it is abandoned by you, give it in this bowl.

original: tatas tīvreṇa prasādena sā alavaṇikā kulmāsapiṇḍikā pratyekabuddhāya pratipāditā /
analyzed: tatas tīvreṇa prasādena sā a lavaṇikā kulmāsa piṇḍikā pratyekabuddhāya pratipāditā
translated: Then with intense faith, that ball of dough without salt was offered to the solitary buddha.

original: kiṃ manyadhve bhikṣavo yo 'sau daridrapuruṣaḥ eṣa evāsau rājā prasenajit kosalas tena kālena tena samayena /
analyzed: kim manyadhve bhikṣavaḥ yaḥ sau daridra puruṣaḥ eṣaḥ eva asau rājā prasenajit kosalaḥ tena kālena tena samayena
translated: What do you think, monks? The poor man then is none other than King Prasenajit of Kosala at that time, on that occasion.

analyzed: yat anena pratyekabuddhāya a lavaṇikā kulmāsa piṇḍikā pratipāditā
translated: Because by him a ball of dough without salt was offered to the solitary buddha.

original: tena karmaṇā ṣaṭkṛtvo deveṣu trayastriṃśeṣu rājaiśvaryādhipatyaṃ fol / GBM / kāritavān /
analyzed: tena karmaṇā ṣaṣ kṛtvas deva trayastriṃśa rājan aiśvarya ādhipatya
translated: By that action, he ruled as a king over the Thirty-Three Gods six times.

original: ṣaṭkṛtvo 'syām eva śrāvastyāṃ rājā kṣatriyo mūrdhābhiṣiktas tenaiva karmāvaśeṣeṇa /
analyzed: ṣaṣ kṛtvas syām eva śrāvastyām rājā kṣatriyaḥ mūrdhābhiṣiktaḥ tena eva karma avaśeṣeṇa
translated: Six times he was a king, a kṣatriya anointed on the head, right here in Śrāvastī, by the remaining karma from that.

original: etarhy api rājā kṣatriyo mūrdhābhiṣiktaḥ saṃvṛttaḥ /
analyzed: etarhi api rājā kṣatriyaḥ mūrdhābhiṣiktaḥ saṃvṛttaḥ
translated: Even now, he has become a king, a kṣatriya anointed on the head.

analyzed: saḥ sya piṇḍakaḥ vipakvaḥ
translated: That alms-food of his has ripened.

analyzed: vipākam tam aham sandhāya kathayāmi
translated: With that ripening in mind, I say this.

analyzed: hasti aśva ratha patti yāyinaḥ bhuñjānasya puram sa naigamam paśyasi
translated: Do you see the city with its merchants and guilds, while enjoying elephants, horses, chariots and infantry?

original: balaṃ hi rūkṣikāyā alavaṇikāyāḥ kulmāsapiṇḍikāyāḥ // iti /
analyzed: balam hi rūkṣikāyāḥ a lavaṇikāyāḥ kulmāsa piṇḍikāyāḥ iti
translated: For the strength of a ball of bitter, saltless porridge is great.

analyzed: sāmantakena śabdaḥ visṛtaḥ
translated: The news spread by word of mouth.

original: bhagavatā rājñaḥ prasenajitaḥ kosalasyālavaṇikā kulmāsapiṇḍikām ārabhya karmaplotir vyākṛteti MSV I
analyzed: bhagavatā rājñaḥ prasenajitaḥ kosalasya a lavaṇikā kulmāsa piṇḍikām ārabhya karma plotiḥ vyākṛtā iti
translated: The Blessed One has prophesied the karmic bond of King Prasenajit of Kosala, beginning with the ball of bitter porridge.

original: rājñā prasenajitkosalena śrutam /🔽sa yena bhagavāṃs tenopasaṃkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: rājñā prasenajit kosalena śrutam  sa yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: King Prasenajit of Kosala heard about it.🔽He approached the Blessed One.

original: upsaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvaikānte niṣaṇṇaḥ /
analyzed: upsaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā ekānte niṣaṇṇaḥ
translated: Having approached, he bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One and sat to one side.

original: ekāntaniṣaṇṇaṃ rājānaṃ prasenajitaṃ kosalaṃ bhagavān dharmyayā kathayā pūrvavad yāvat saṃpraharṣya tūṣṇīm /
analyzed: ekānta niṣaṇṇam rājānam prasenajitam kosalam bhagavān dharmyayā kathayā pūrvavat yāvat saṃpraharṣya tūṣṇīm
translated: The Blessed One, having gladdened King Prasenajit of Kosala with a Dharma talk as before, remained silent.

original: atha rājā prasenajit kosala utthāyāsanād ekāṃsam uttarāsaṃgaṃ kṛtvā bhagavantam idam avocat /
analyzed: atha rājā prasenajit kosalaḥ utthāya āsanāt eka aṃsam uttarāsaṃgam kṛtvā bhagavantam idam avocat
translated: Then King Prasenajit of Kosala rose from his seat, arranged his upper robe over one shoulder, and said this to the Blessed One:

original: adhivāsayatu me bhagavāṃs traimāsīṃ cīvarapiṇḍapātaśayanāsanaglānapratyayabhaiṣajyapariṣkāraiḥ sārdhaṃ bhikṣusaṃgheneti /
analyzed: adhivāsayatu me bhagavān traimāsīm cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkāraiḥ sārdham bhikṣu saṃghena iti
translated: May the Blessed One consent to spend the three months of the rainy season with the community of monks, providing robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicines for the sick.

analyzed: adhivāsayati bhagavān rājñaḥ prasenajit kosalasya tūṣṇīṃbhāvena
translated: The Blessed One consented to King Prasenajit of Kosala by remaining silent.

original: tato rājñā prasenajitā kosalena buddhapramukhāya bhikṣusaṃghāya traimāsīṃ śatarasaṃ bhojanaṃ dattam /
analyzed: tatas rājñā prasenajitā kosalena buddha pramukhāya bhikṣu saṃghāya traimāsīm śata rasam bhojanam dattam
translated: Then King Prasenajit of Kosala gave a hundred-flavored meal to the community of monks headed by the Buddha for three months.

analyzed: ekaikaḥ ca bhikṣuḥ śata sāhasrakeṇa vastreṇa ācchāditaḥ
translated: And each monk was clothed with a hundred-thousand-piece robe.

original: tailasya ca kumbhakoṭiṃ samudānīya dīpamālām abhyudyato dātum /
analyzed: tailasya ca kumbha koṭim samudānīya dīpa mālām abhyudyataḥ dātum
translated: Having collected a koṭi of oil jars, he prepared to give a garland of lamps.

original: tatra bhakte pūjāyāṃ ca mahākolāhalo jātaḥ /
analyzed: tatra bhakte pūjāyām ca mahā kolāhalaḥ jātaḥ
translated: There was a great commotion in the offering and worship.

analyzed: yāvat anyatamā nagara avalambikā atīva duḥkhitā
translated: Then a certain poor woman of the city became extremely distressed.

original: tayā khaṇḍamallakena bhikṣām aṭantyā sa uccaśabdo mahāśabdaḥ śrutaḥ /
analyzed: tayā khaṇḍa mallakena bhikṣām aṭantyā saḥ ucca śabdaḥ mahā śabdaḥ śrutaḥ
translated: As she was going for alms with that broken bowl, she heard that loud and great sound.

analyzed: śrutvā ca punar pṛcchati
translated: Having heard it, she asked,

original: bhavantaḥ kim eṣa uccaśabdo mahāśabda iti /
analyzed: bhavantaḥ kim eṣaḥ ucca śabdaḥ mahā śabdaḥ iti
translated: Sirs, what is this loud and great sound?

analyzed: aparaiḥ samākhyātam
translated: Others informed her,

original: rājñā prasenajitā kosalena buddhapramukho bhikṣusaṃghas traimāsīṃ bhojitaḥ /
analyzed: rājñā prasenajitā kosalena buddha pramukhaḥ bhikṣu saṃghaḥ traimāsīm bhojitaḥ
translated: King Prasenajit of Kosala has fed the community of monks headed by the Buddha for three months,

analyzed: ekaikaḥ ca bhikṣuḥ śata sahasra mūlyena vastreṇa ācchāditaḥ
translated: and has clothed each monk with a robe worth a hundred thousand.

original: tailakumbhakoṭiṃ ca samudānīya dīpamālām abhyudyato dātum iti /
analyzed: taila kumbha koṭim ca samudānīya dīpa mālām abhyudyataḥ dātum iti
translated: And having collected ten million oil pots, he is about to offer a garland of lamps.

analyzed: tatas tasyāḥ nagara avalambikāyāḥ etat abhavat
translated: Then that woman who lived off the city

original: ayaṃ rājā prasenajit kosalaḥ puṇyair atṛptaḥ adyatvena dānāni dadāti puṇyāni MSV I karoti /
analyzed: ayam rājā prasenajit kosalaḥ puṇyaiḥ atṛptaḥ adyatvena dānāni dadāti puṇyāni i karoti
translated: thought, This King Prasenajit of Kosala is not satisfied with his merit. Even now he gives gifts and makes merit.

original: yanv aham api kutaścit samudānīya bhagavataḥ pradīpaṃ dadyām iti tayā khaṇḍamallakena tailasya stokaṃ yācitvā pradīpaḥ prajvālya bhagavataś
analyzed: yanu aham api kutaścid samudānīya bhagavataḥ pradīpam dadyām iti tayā khaṇḍa mallakena tailasya stokam yācitvā pradīpaḥ prajvālya bhagavataḥ
translated: Well then, I too will collect something from somewhere and offer a lamp to the Blessed One. She asked for a little oil in a broken bowl, lit a lamp,

analyzed: caṃkrame dattaḥ
translated: and placed it in the Blessed One's walking place.

analyzed: pādayoḥ ca nipatya praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: And having fallen at his feet, she made a vow:

original: anenāhaṃ kuśalamūlena yathāyaṃ bhagavān śākyamunir varṣaśatāyuṣi prajāyāṃ śāstā loke utpannaḥ evam aham api varṣaśatāyuṣi śākyamunir eva śāstā
analyzed: anena aham kuśala mūlena yathā ayam bhagavān śākyamuniḥ varṣa śata āyuṣi prajāyām śāstā loke utpannaḥ evam aham api varṣa śata āyuṣi śākyamuniḥ eva śāstā  /
translated: By this root of merit, may I become just like this Blessed One Śākyamuni, a teacher in the world when the lifespan is one hundred years, just as he is.

analyzed: bhaveyam
translated: May I be called Śākyamuni, just as he is.

original: yathā cāsya śāriputramaudgalyāyanāv agrayugaṃ bhadrayugam ānando bhikṣur upasthāyikaḥ
analyzed: yathā ca asya śāriputra maudgalyāyanau agra yugam bhadra yugam ānandaḥ bhikṣuḥ upasthāyikaḥ
translated: Just as he has Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana as his foremost pair, a good pair, and the monk Ānanda as his attendant,

original: śuddhodanaḥ pitā mahāmāyā mātā kapilavastu nagaraṃ rāhulabhadraḥ kumāraḥ evaṃ mamāpi
analyzed: śuddhodanaḥ pitā mahāmāyā mātā kapilavastu nagaram rāhulabhadraḥ kumāraḥ evam mama api
translated: just as his father is Śuddhodana, his mother is Mahāmāyā, his city is Kapilavastu, and his son is the young prince Rāhulabhadra, may I also have

original: śāriputramaudgalyāyanāv agrayugaṃ bhadrayugaṃ syād ānando bhikṣur upasthāyikaḥ fol / GBM /
analyzed: śāriputra maudgalyāyanau agra yugam bhadra yuga SNNe syāt as SPr3O ānandaḥ bhikṣu upasthāyika
translated: Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana as my foremost pair, a good pair, and the monk Ānanda as my attendant,

original: śuddhodanaḥ pitā mātā mahāmāyā kapilavastu nagaraṃ rāhulabhadraḥ kumāraḥ putraḥ /
analyzed: śuddhodanaḥ pitā mātā mahāmāyā kapilavastu nagaram rāhulabhadraḥ kumāraḥ putraḥ
translated: just as his father is Śuddhodana, his mother is Mahāmāyā, his city is Kapilavastu, and his son is the young prince Rāhulabhadra.

original: yathā cāyaṃ bhagavān dhātuvibhāgaṃ kṛtvā parinirvāsyati evam aham api dhātuvibhāgaṃ kṛtvā parinirvāpayeyam iti /
analyzed: yathā ca ayam bhagavān dhātu vibhāgam kṛtvā parinirvāsyati evam aham api dhātu vibhāgam kṛtvā parinirvāpayeyam iti
translated: Just as this Blessed One, having divided his relics, will attain parinirvāṇa, may I also, having divided my relics, attain parinirvāṇa.

original: yāvat sarve te dīpāḥ parinirvāṇāḥ sa tayā prajvālito dīpo jvalaty eva /
analyzed: yāvat sarve te dīpāḥ parinirvāṇāḥ sa tayā prajvālitaḥ dīpaḥ jvalati eva
translated: Until all those lamps were extinguished, the lamp that she lit continued to burn.🔽And the Blessed One, knowing the significance of it, spoke this verse on the spot:

original: dharmatā khalu buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ na tāvad upasthāpakaḥ pratisaṃlīyati yāvan na buddhā bhagavantaḥ pratisaṃlīnā iti /
analyzed: dharmatā khalu buddhānām bhagavatām na tāvat upasthāpakaḥ pratisaṃlīyati yāvat na buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ pratisaṃlīnāḥ iti
translated: It is natural that the attendants do not go to rest as long as the Blessed Buddhas have not gone to rest.

analyzed: āyuṣmān ānandaḥ saṃlakṣayati
translated: The Venerable Ānanda thought:

original: asthānam anavakāśo yad buddhā bhagavantaḥ ālokaśayyāṃ kalpayiṣyanti yanv ahaṃ pradīpaṃ nirvāpayeyam ti /
analyzed: asthānam anavakāśaḥ yat buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ āloka śayyām kalpayiṣyanti yanu aham pradīpam nirvāpayeyam ti
translated: It is not possible that the Blessed Buddhas would make their bed in the light. Let me extinguish the lamp.

original: sa hastena nirvāpayitum ārabdho na śaknoti tataś cīvarakarṇikena tato vyajanena tathāpi na śaknotīti /
analyzed: sa hastena nirvāpayitum ārabdhaḥ na śaknoti tatas cīvarakarṇikena tatas vyajanena tathā api na śaknoti iti
translated: He began to extinguish it with his hand, but was unable to. Then with the corner of his robe, then with a fan, still he was unable.

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: mā khedam ānanda āpatsyase
translated: Do not be troubled, Ānanda.

original: yadi vairaṃbhā api vāyavo vāyeyus te 'pi na śaknuyur nirvāpayituṃ prāg eva hastacīvarakarṇiko vyajanaṃ vā /
analyzed: yadi vairaṃbhāḥ api vāyavaḥ vāyeyuḥ te na śaknuyuḥ nirvāpayitum prāk eva hasta cīvara karṇikaḥ vyajanam vā
translated: Even if the Vairambha winds were to blow, they would not be able to extinguish it, much less the corner of your hand, robe, or fan.

original: tathā MSV I hy ayaṃ pradīpas tayā dārikayā mahatā cittābhisaṃskāreṇa prajvālitaḥ /
analyzed: tathā msu i hi ayam pradīpaḥ tayā dārikayā mahatā citta abhisaṃskāreṇa prajvālitaḥ
translated: For this lamp was lit by that girl with a great mental effort.

original: api tv ānanda bhaviṣyaty asau dārikā varṣaśatāyuṣi prajāyāṃ śākyamunir nāma tathāgato 'rhatsamyaksaṃbuddhaḥ /
analyzed: api tu ānanda bhaviṣyati asau dārikā varṣa śata āyuṣi prajāyām śākyamuniḥ nāma tathāgataḥ rhat samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: However, Ānanda, that girl will become, in a time when the lifespan of beings is a hundred years, a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a Perfectly Enlightened One named Śākyamuni.

original: śāriputramaudgalyāyanau tasyāgrayugaṃ bhadrayugam ānando bhikṣur upasthāyikaḥ śuddhodanaḥ pitā mātā mahāmāyā kapilavastu nagaraṃ rāhulabhadraḥ
analyzed: śāriputra maudgalyāyanau tasya agra yugam bhadra yugam ānandaḥ bhikṣuḥ upasthāyikaḥ śuddhodanaḥ pitā mātā mahāmāyā kapilavastu nagaram rāhulabhadraḥ  /
translated: Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana were his chief pair, Ānanda was his attendant monk, Śuddhodana was his father, Mahāmāyā was his mother, the city was Kapilavastu, and Rāhulabhadra

analyzed: kumāraḥ putraḥ
translated: was his son, the prince.

analyzed: sā api dhātu vibhāgam kṛtvā parinirvāsyati iti
translated: She will also attain parinirvāṇa after dividing her relics.

analyzed: sāmantakena śabdaḥ visṛtaḥ
translated: The news spread in the vicinity:

analyzed: amukayā nagara avalambikayā bhagavataḥ caṃkrame śirasā pradīpaḥ dattaḥ

analyzed: sā bhagavatā anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau vyākṛtā
translated: She was prophesied by the Blessed One to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: iti śrutvā śrāddhair brāhmaṇagṛhapatibhir asāv anāgataguṇāpekṣayā sarvopakaraṇaiḥ pravāritā /
analyzed: iti śrutvā śrāddhaiḥ brāhmaṇa gṛhapatibhiḥ asau anāgata guṇa apekṣayā sarva upakaraṇaiḥ pravāritā
translated: Hearing this, the faithful brahmins and householders, expecting future qualities, provided her with all requisites.

analyzed: tathā rajñā prasenajitā kosalena śrutam
translated: In the same way, it was heard by King Prasenajit of Kośala.

original: tato vismayajātas tailakumbhasahasram ādāya citrāṃ pradīpamālāṃ kṛtavān /
analyzed: tatas vismaya jātaḥ taila kumbha sahasram ādāya citrām pradīpa mālām kṛtavān

analyzed: catur ratna mayam ca pradīpam caṃkrama śirasi pratiṣṭhitavān
translated: And he placed a lamp made of the four jewels on the head of the walkway.

original: tato bhagavataḥ sakāśaṃ gatvā bhagavantam idam avocat /
analyzed: tatas bhagavataḥ sakāśam gatvā bhagavantam idam avocat

analyzed: mayā ca bhadanta bhagavān ārya mahākāśyapasya pūjā adhikāreṇa bhakta saptāhena upanimaṃtritaḥ
translated: And, Venerable One, I invited the Blessed One to a seven-day meal for the purpose of worshiping the noble Mahākāśyapa.

original: tasya mama bhagavatā alavaṇikāṃ kulmāsapiṇḍikām ārabhya pūrvikā karmaplotir vyākṛtā /
analyzed: tasya mama bhagavatā a lavaṇikām kulmāsa piṇḍikām ārabhya pūrvikā karma plotiḥ vyākṛtā

analyzed: punar ca mayā bhagavān traimāsīm sa śrāvaka saṃghaḥ bhojitaḥ
translated: And again I fed the Blessed One and his community of monks for three months,

original: ekaikaś ca bhikṣuḥ śatasahasreṇa mūlyena vastrayugenācchāditas tailakumbhakoṭiṃ ca samudānīya pradīpamālā dattā /

translated: and I clothed each monk with a pair of robes worth a hundred thousand, and having collected a koṭi of oil-jars, I offered a garland of lamps.

analyzed: na ca aham bhagavatā anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau vyākṛtaḥ
translated: But I was not predicted by the Blessed One to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: sādhu bhagavān mama api anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau vyākuryāt
translated: It would be good if the Blessed One would predict me to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: kadāsvid aham loka jyeṣṭhaḥ syām vināyakaḥ iti
translated: When will I become the chief in the world, the leader?

analyzed: bhagavān i āha

analyzed: gambhīrā mahā rāja anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ
translated: Great king, unsurpassed perfect enlightenment is profound.

analyzed: sā na sukara tvad SI eka dāna samupadānī In
translated: It is not easy for you alone to accomplish that gift,

analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhim abhiprārthayitā dātavyāni eva dānāni kartavyāni eva puṇyāni sevitavyāni

analyzed: anuttarām bhadanta bhagavatā samyaksaṃbodhim prārhayitā kiyanti dānāni dattāni puṇyāni vā kṛtāni iti
translated: Blessed One, when you aspired to the highest complete enlightenment, how many gifts were given, how many meritorious deeds were done?

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: tiṣṭhantu tāvat mahā rāja ye tītāḥ kalpāḥ
translated: Let alone, for now, the past eons,

analyzed: yat mayā asmin eva bhadrake kalpe anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim prārthayitā dānāni dattāni puṇyāni ca aneka prakārāṇi kṛtāni tat śṛṇuta sādhu ca suṣṭhu
translated: What I have done in this very Bhadrakalpa, when I was seeking for supreme perfect enlightenment, the gifts I gave, and the various kinds of merit I made, listen to that well and thoroughly,

translated: and pay attention well, I will speak.

original: abhirūpo darśanīyaḥ prāsādiko gauraḥ kanakavarṇaś chatrākāraśirāḥ pralambabāhur vistīrṇalalāṭaḥ

translated: He was handsome, good-looking, pleasing, fair, golden-colored, with a head shaped like a parasol, long arms, a broad forehead,

analyzed: jāta mātraḥ kumāraḥ ntaḥpuram praveśitaḥ

analyzed: ekaikā strī kathayati māndhāya māndhāya iti

analyzed: anye kathayanti

analyzed: antaḥpure hiraṇya varṣam

translated: King Māndhātṛ thought, These are not the Vaiśālī people, but the Yakṣas.

analyzed: rājā māndhātā pṛcchati
translated: King Māndhātṛ asked,

analyzed: kena etat bhaṭabalāgram stambhitam
translated: By whom was this army of soldiers paralyzed?

analyzed: devarṣiṇā
translated: By the celestial sage.

analyzed: rājā pṛcchati
translated: The king asked,

analyzed: kim teṣām ṛṣīṇām priyam  deva jaṭāḥ

analyzed: śīryantām eṣām jaṭāḥ

original: mama ca purojavāḥ santu /🔽tatas teṣāṃ jaṭāḥ śīrṇāḥ /

analyzed: dhanuḥ bāṇa pāṇayaḥ ca agratas dhāvitum ārabdhāḥ

analyzed: strī ratnena abhihitam

analyzed: deva ṛṣayaḥ ete tapasvinaḥ

analyzed: kim ebhiḥ
translated: What should be done with them?

analyzed: mucyantām iti
translated: Let them be released.

analyzed: rājñā muktāḥ
translated: They were released by the king.

original: taiḥ punar api vīryam āsthāya paṃcābhijñāḥ sākṣātkṛtāḥ /
analyzed: taiḥ punar api vīryam āsthāya paṃca abhijñāḥ sākṣātkṛtāḥ
translated: Then, having again applied themselves with vigor, they actualized the five higher knowledges.

original: tathā nandopanando nāgarājo māndhātṛbalaṃ dṛṣṭvā asurā hy ete iti caturaṅgena balakāyena pratyudgataḥ /
analyzed: tathā nanda upanandaḥ nāga rājaḥ māndhātṛ balam dṛṣṭvā asurāḥ hi ete iti catur aṅgena balakāyena pratyudgataḥ
translated: Similarly, the nāga king Nanda- Upananda, seeing Māndhātṛ's army, thought, These are asuras, and went out to meet them with a four-division army.

analyzed: sainya darśanāt eva bhagnaḥ
translated: He was shattered just by seeing the army.

original: deva karoṭapāṇayo yakṣā māyādharāḥ sadāmattāś ca /
analyzed: deva karoṭa pāṇayaḥ yakṣāḥ māyā dharāḥ sadāmattāḥ ca
translated: O king, these are the Yakṣas with skull-cups in their hands, who are magicians and always intoxicated.

original: sarve ca nandopanandādayo bhagnā yena cāturmahārājikā devās tenopasaṃkrāntāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ca nanda upananda ādayaḥ bhagnāḥ yena cāturmahārājikāḥ devāḥ tena upasaṃkrāntāḥ
translated: And all Nanda, Upananda, and the others were defeated by him. He then went to the gods of the Four Great Kings.

analyzed: upasaṃkramya cāturmahārājikān devān idam avocat
translated: Having arrived, he said this to the gods of the Four Great Kings:

original: yat khalu mārṣā jānīdhvaṃ mahāsainyaṃ pratyupasthitam /
analyzed: yat khalu mārṣāḥ jānīdhvam mahā sainyam pratyupasthitam

analyzed: sannahyatām catur aṃgaḥ balakāyaḥ
translated: Arm the four divisions of the army.

analyzed: vayam sarve bhagnāḥ iti
translated: We are all defeated.

analyzed: taiḥ parijñātam
translated: They recognized him.

analyzed: te kathayanti
translated: They said:

original: bhavantaḥ ayaṃ māndhātā rājā cakravartī śakraṃ devendraṃ darśanāya gacchati /
analyzed: bhavantaḥ ayam māndhātā rājā cakravartī śakram deva indram darśanāya gacchati

original: puṇyamaheśākhyaś cāyam /🔽kā śaktir asmākam anena sārdhaṃ saṃgrāmayitum /
analyzed: puṇya maheśākhyaḥ ca ayam  kā śaktiḥ asmākam anena sārdham saṃgrāmayitum
translated: And he is greatly renowned for his merit.🔽What power do we have to fight with him?

original: kin tu ardhaṃ pādyaṃ ca gṛhītvā pratyudgantavyam iti /🔽tataś cāturmahārājikā devā ardhaṃ pādyaṃ ca gṛhītvā cchatradhvajapatākābhir vividhaiś ca vādyaiḥ pratyudgatāḥ /
analyzed: kin tu ardham pādyam ca gṛhītvā pratyudgantavyam iti  tatas cāturmahārājikāḥ devāḥ ardham pādyam ca gṛhītvā chatra dhvaja patākābhiḥ vividhaiḥ ca vādyaiḥ pratyudgatāḥ
translated: But we should take half of the water for washing the feet and go out to meet him.🔽Then the gods of the Four Great Kings, taking half of the water for washing the feet, went out to meet him with parasols, banners, flags, and various musical instruments.

original: tato rājā māndhātā cāturmahārājikān devān pratisaṃmodya devaiḥ parivṛto devāṃs trayastriṃśān gataḥ /
analyzed: tatas rājā māndhātā cāturmahārājikān devān pratisaṃmodya devaiḥ parivṛtaḥ devān trayastriṃśān gataḥ

analyzed: śakreṇa ca deva indreṇa ardhāsanena upanimantritaḥ

original: tato 'surāś caturaṅgaṃ balakāyaṃ sannahya śakraṃ devendram abhigatāḥ /
analyzed: tatas surāḥ caturaṅgam balakāyam sannahya śakram deva indram abhigatāḥ

analyzed: yakṣaiḥ śakrasya deva indrasya ārocitam

original: yat khalu kauśika jānīyā asurāḥ paṃca gulmakān bhaṅktvā pratyupasthitāḥ /
analyzed: yat khalu kauśika jānīyāḥ asurāḥ paṃca gulmakān bhaṅktvā pratyupasthitāḥ
translated: Kauśika, you should know that the asuras, having broken the five divisions, have come.

original: yat te kṛtyaṃ karaṇīyaṃ vā tat kuruṣveti /
analyzed: yat te kṛtyam karaṇīyam vā tat kuruṣva iti
translated: Do whatever you need to do.

analyzed: tatas śakraḥ deva indraḥ saṃprasthitaḥ

analyzed: rājñā māndhātrā abhihitaḥ
translated: King Māndhātṛ said to him,

analyzed: tiṣṭha aham eva gacchāmi iti

analyzed: śakraḥ kathayati
translated: Śakra said,

analyzed: evam kuruṣva iti
translated: Do so.

original: tato rājā māndhātā aṣṭādaśabhir bhaṭabalāgrakoṭībhir upari vihāyasam abhyudgamya guṇāsphālanaṃ kṛtavān /
analyzed: tatas rājā māndhātā aṣṭādaśabhiḥ bhaṭabalāgra koṭībhiḥ upari vihāyasam abhyudgamya guṇa āsphālanam kṛtavān
translated: Then King Māndhātṛ, together with eighteen koṭis of a four-divisioned army, rose up into the sky and made a loud noise.

original: asurā aṣṭādaśa bhaṭabalāgrakoṭībhir dṛṣṭvā ativibhīṣaṇaṃ ca śabdaṃ śrutvā karṇau pidhāya niṣpalāyitāḥ /
analyzed: asurāḥ aṣṭādaśa bhaṭabalāgra koṭībhiḥ dṛṣṭvā ati vibhīṣaṇam ca śabdam śrutvā karṇau pidhāya niṣpalāyitāḥ
translated: The asuras, seeing the eighteen koṭis of a four-divisioned army, and hearing an extremely terrifying sound, covered their ears and fled.

analyzed: tatas rājñaḥ māndhātuḥ etat abhavat
translated: Then this occurred to King Māndhātṛ:

original: asti me jambudvīpe dvīpaḥ ṛddhaś ca sphītaś ca kṣemaś ca subhikṣaś cākīrṇabahujanamanuṣyaś ca pūrvavidehaḥ avaragodānīyaḥ uttarakuruś ca /

translated: I have an island in Jambudvīpa, which is prosperous, flourishing, peaceful, abundant in food, and full of many people - the eastern Videha, the western Godānīya, and the northern Kuru.

analyzed: yanu aham devānām ca manuṣyāṇām ca rājya aiśvarya ādhipatyam kārayeyam iti

analyzed: saha saha  citta upādāt rājā māndhātā tad SGM ṛddhe ṛdh SLPaNe parihīne jambudvīpa

analyzed: āgatya kharam ābādhitam praveditavān gāthām ca bhāṣate

analyzed: alpa āsvādān bahu duḥkhān kāmān vijñāya paṇḍitaḥ

analyzed: tṛṣṇā kṣaye rataḥ bhavati samyaksaṃbuddha śrāvakaḥ

analyzed: parvataḥ pi suvarṇasya samaḥ himavatā bhavet

analyzed: karaṇīyāni puṇyāni duḥkham hi a kṛta puṇyataḥ

analyzed: kṛta puṇyāḥ hi modante loke smin ca paratra ca iti

translated: Then King Mahasudarsana, having fed five hundred Pratyekabuddhas in the Dharma palace and clothed each with a pair of garments, spoke a verse:

analyzed: labdhvā hi vipulam bhogam na pramādyet vicakṣaṇaḥ

analyzed: dadyāt saṃpanna śīlebhyaḥ yatra ridhyanti dakṣiṇāḥ

translated: Thus giving here, the wise one, faithful and with a liberated mind,

analyzed: a vyāvāda sukhe loke upapadyeta paṇḍitaḥ iti
translated: The wise one will be reborn in a world of happiness without conflict.

original: syāt khalu te mahārāja anyaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayena mahāsudarśano nāma rājā
analyzed: syāt khalu te mahā rāja anyaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayena mahāsudarśanaḥ nāma rājā

analyzed: cakravartī catur dvīpa īśvaraḥ saptati ratnaiḥ samanvāgataḥ catasṛbhiḥ ca mānuṣika abhi

original: riddhibhir iti na khalv evaṃ draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: riddhibhiḥ iti na khalu evam draṣṭavyam
translated: It should not be seen like this.

original: api tv aham eva sa tena kālena tena samayena mahāsudarśano nāma rājā cakravartī caturdvīpeśvaraḥ saptatiratnaiḥ samanvāgataś catasṛbhiś ca
analyzed: api tu aham eva sa tena kālena tena samayena mahāsudarśanaḥ nāma rājā cakravartī catur dvīpa īśvaraḥ saptati ratnaiḥ samanvāgataḥ catasṛbhiḥ ca
translated: But I myself at that time, on that occasion, was the king named Mahā-Sudarśana, a universal monarch, lord of the four continents, endowed with the seven treasures and

analyzed: mānuṣikābhiḥ riddhibhiḥ
translated: the four

translated: It may be, Your Majesty, that you think that by that giving or distribution of gifts I attained supreme and complete awakening. But that should not be seen like this.

translated: But that giving was merely a cause, merely a condition, merely a preparation for supreme and complete awakening.

original: punar api mahārāja yan mayā anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhiṃ prārthayatā dānāni dattāni puṇyāni ca kṛtāni tac chrūyatām /
analyzed: punar api mahā rāja yat mayā anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim prārthayatā dānāni dattāni puṇyāni ca kṛtāni tat śrūyatām
translated: Again, Your Majesty, listen to how, when I was seeking supreme and complete awakening, I gave gifts and made merit.

analyzed: bhūta pūrvam mahā rāja velāmaḥ nāma brāhmaṇa mahā sālaḥ bhūt
translated: In the past, Your Majesty, there was a great brāhmaṇa named Vāmadeva.

original: sa idam evaṃrūpaṃ brāhmaṇebhyo dānam adāc fol / GBM /
analyzed: saḥ idam evaṃrūpa brāhmaṇebhyaḥ dāna adāt
translated: He gave this kind of gift to the brāhmaṇas.

analyzed: caturaśīti nāga sahasrāṇām suvarṇa alaṃkārāṇām suvarṇa dhvajānām hema jāla praticchannānām
translated: eighty-four thousand elephants with golden ornaments, golden banners, covered with nets of gold.

analyzed: vistareṇa velāmasūtre madhyama āgame brāhmaṇanipāte
translated: In detail, in the Vellāma Sūtra, in the Middle Length Collection, in the Brāhmaṇa Section.

original: sa evaṃ dānāni datvā gāthāṃ bhāṣate /
analyzed: saḥ evam dānāni da tvā gāthām bhāṣate
translated: Having given those gifts in this way, he spoke this verse:

analyzed: dānam da tvā sukhī hi syāt dānam da tvā viśāradaḥ

analyzed: dānena pūjyate sādhu deveṣu manujeṣu ca

analyzed: tasmāt saṃpatti kāmena dānam deyam viśāradaiḥ
translated: Therefore, by one who desires prosperity, gifts should be given fearlessly.

original: mokṣam ākāṃkṣatā nityam aiśvaryaṃ ca surālayam //
analyzed: mokṣam ākāṃkṣatā nityam aiśvaryam ca surālayam
translated: By one who always desires liberation, and sovereignty in the heavenly realms.

original: syāt khalu te mahārāja anyaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayena velāmo nāma brāhmaṇamahāsālo 'bhūt /

translated: Great King, it may occur to you that at that time, on that occasion, the great wealthy brāhmaṇa named Vellāma was someone else.

analyzed: na khalu evam draṣṭavyam
translated: But you should not see it like that.

original: aham eva sa tena kālena tena samayena velāmo nāma brāhmaṇamahāsālo 'bhūvam /
analyzed: aham eva sa tena kālena tena samayena velāmaḥ nāma brāhmaṇa mahā sālaḥ bhūvam
translated: I myself was the great wealthy brāhmaṇa named Vellāma at that time, on that occasion.

original: mayā tad evaṃvidhaṃ brāhmaṇebhyo dānaṃ dattam /
analyzed: mayā tat evaṃvidham brāhmaṇebhyaḥ dānam dattam
translated: That kind of gift was given by me to the brāhmaṇas.

original: syāt khalu te mahārāja tena mayā dānena vā dānasaṃvibhāgenānuttarā samyaksaṃbodhir adhigateti na khalv evaṃ draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: syāt khalu te mahā rāja tena mayā dānena vā dāna saṃvibhāgena anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ adhigatā iti na khalu evam draṣṭavyam
translated: Great king, it might occur to you that 'By that generosity or distribution of gifts, I attained unsurpassed perfect enlightenment,' but you should not see it like that.

original: api tu tad dānam anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodher hetumātrakaṃ pratyayamātrakaṃ saṃbhāramātrakam /

original: kuśenaiva bhikṣavaḥ karmāṇi kṛtāny upacitāni labdhasaṃbhārāṇi pariṇatapratyayāny oghavat pratyupasthitāni avaśyaṃbhāvīni /

original: na bhikṣavaḥ karmāṇi kṛtāny upacitāni bāhye pṛthivīdhātau vipacyante nābdhātau na tejodhātau na vāyudhātau /

translated: Monks, actions that have been performed and accumulated are not ripened in the external elements - in the earth element, in the water element, in the fire element, or in the air element.

original: api tūpātteṣv eva skandhadhātvāyataneṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni vipacyante śubhāny aśubhāni ca /

translated: But rather, actions that have been performed and accumulated are ripened in the aggregates, elements, and sense-spheres that have been appropriated. The wholesome and unwholesome ones.

original: na praṇaśyanti karmāṇi api kalpaśatair api /
analyzed: na praṇaśyanti karmāṇi api kalpa śataiḥ api

analyzed: tasmāt tarhi bhikṣavaḥ evam śikṣitavyam

analyzed: nānā raṃgaiḥ sūtrakaiḥ veṣṭayitvā mantraiḥ āvartitaḥ
translated: Having wrapped them with multi-colored threads, he recited mantras.

analyzed: tatas tat pānīyam utkvathitum ārabdham
translated: Then that water began to boil.

original: lubdhakena śareṇa marmaṇi tāḍito niṣkośaṃ cāsiṃ kṛtvābhihitaḥ /
analyzed: lubdhakena śareṇa marmaṇi tāḍitaḥ niṣkośam ca asim kṛtvā abhihitaḥ
translated: The hunter struck him in a vital spot with an arrow, unsheathed his sword, and said:

analyzed: tvam asmin viṣaya nivāsinam nāga potakam mantreṇa apaharasi
translated: You are stealing the young nāga who lives in this realm with a mantra.

analyzed: mantrān upasaṃhara
translated: Withdraw the mantras.

original: mā te utkṛttamūlaṃ śiraḥ kṛtvā pṛthivyāṃ nipātayiṣyāmīti /
analyzed: mā te utkṛtta mūlam śiraḥ kṛtvā pṛthivyām nipātayiṣyāmi iti
translated: Otherwise, I will cut off your head at the root and make it fall to the ground.

analyzed: tata ahituṇḍikena duḥkha vedanā abhibhūtena mantrāḥ vyāvartitāḥ
translated: Then, overwhelmed by the pain, the snake charmer withdrew the mantras.

original: tena ca samanantaraṃ lubdhakena jīvitād vyavaropitaḥ /
analyzed: tena ca samanantaram lubdhakena jīvitāt vyavaropitaḥ
translated: And immediately after that, the hunter killed him.

original: tato nāgapoto mantrapāśabandhanād vinirmukto hradād abhyudgatya taṃ lubdhakaṃ pariṣvaktavān evaṃ cāha /
analyzed: tatas nāga potaḥ mantra pāśa bandhanāt vinirmuktaḥ hradāt abhyudgatya tam lubdhakam pariṣvaktavān evam ca āha
translated: Then the young nāga, released from the bonds of the mantra noose, rose up from the lake, embraced the hunter, and said:

original: tvaṃ me mātā tvaṃ pitā yan mama tvam āgamya mātāpitṛviyogajaṃ duḥkhaṃ notpannam /
analyzed: tvam me mātā tvam pitā yat mama tvam āgamya mātā pitṛ viyoga jam duḥkham na utpannam
translated: You are my mother, you are my father, because due to you, the suffering of separation from my mother and father did not arise for me.

analyzed: āgaccha bhuvanam gacchāvaḥ
translated: Come, let us go to my world.

original: tenāsau svabhuvanaṃ nīto nānāvidhena cānnapānena saṃtarpito ratnāni copadarśitāni /
analyzed: tena asau sva bhuvanam nītaḥ nānāvidhena ca anna pānena saṃtarpitaḥ ratnāni ca upadarśitāni
translated: He was taken to his own world by him, and was satisfied with various kinds of food and drink, and was shown jewels.

analyzed: mātā pitroḥ ca niveditam
translated: And he informed his mother and father:

original: amba tāta eṣa me suhṛccharaṇyaṃ MSV I
analyzed: amba tāta eṣa me suhṛd śaraṇyam
translated: Mother, Father, this is my friend, my refuge, my

original: bāndhavo 'syānubhāvān mama yuṣmābhiḥ saha viyogo na jāta iti /
analyzed: bāndhavaḥ sya anubhāvāt mama yuṣmābhiḥ saha viyogaḥ na jātaḥ iti
translated: kinsman. By his power, I have not been separated from you.

original: tābhyām apy asau vareṇa pravārito vividhāni ratnāni dattāni /
analyzed: tābhyām api asau vareṇa pravāritaḥ vividhāni ratnāni dattāni
translated: And he was also given various jewels by them, as they bestowed a boon upon him.

original: sa tāny ādāya tasmād hradād vyutthitaḥ /
analyzed: sa tāni ādāya tasmāt hradāt vyutthitaḥ
translated: Taking them, he rose up from the lake.

original: tasya hradasya nātidūre puṣpaphalasampannaṃ nānāśakunibhir nikūjitam āśramapadam /
analyzed: tasya hradasya na atidūre puṣpa phala sampannam nānā śakunibhiḥ nikūjitam āśrama padam
translated: Not far from that lake, there was an ashram rich with flowers and fruits, resounding with the songs of various birds.

original: tatra ṛṣiḥ prativasati maitryātmakaḥ kāruṇikaḥ satvavatsalaḥ /
analyzed: tatra ṛṣiḥ prativasati maitrī ātmakaḥ kāruṇikaḥ satva vatsalaḥ
translated: There lived a sage, who was full of love, compassionate, and fond of beings.

original: tato 'sau lubdhakas tasya ṛṣes triṣkālam upasaṃkramitum ārabdhaḥ /
analyzed: tatas u sau lubdhakaḥ tasya ṛṣeḥ triṣkālam upasaṃkramitum ārabdhaḥ
translated: Then the hunter began to visit the sage three times a day.

original: yac cāsya janmacitreṇa nāgapotena sārdhaṃ vṛttaṃ tat sarvaṃ vistareṇa samākhyātam /
analyzed: yat ca asya janmacitreṇa nāga potena sārdham vṛttam tat sarvam vistareṇa samākhyātam
translated: And he told in detail all that had happened to him with the young nāga Jālinīprabha.

analyzed: tatas saḥ ṛṣiḥ kathayati
translated: Then the sage said,

original: kiṃ ratnaiḥ kiṃ vā te suvarṇena tasya bhuvane amogho nāma pāśas tiṣṭhati taṃ yācasveti /
analyzed: kim ratnaiḥ kim vā te suvarṇena tasya bhuvane amoghaḥ nāma pāśaḥ tiṣṭhati tam yācasva iti
translated: What do you need with jewels or gold? In his world there is a noose called Amogha. Ask for that.

original: tato lubdhako 'moghapāśe jātatṛṣṇaḥ ṛṣivacanam upaśrutya punar api nāgabhuvanaṃ gato yāvat paśyati nāgabhuvanadvāre tam amoghaṃ pāśam /
analyzed: tatas lubdhakaḥ mogha pāśe jāta tṛṣṇaḥ ṛṣi vacanam upaśrutya punar api nāgabhuvanam gataḥ yāvat paśyati nāgabhuvana dvāre tam amogham pāśam
translated: Then the hunter, his craving for the Amogha noose born, having heard the sage's words, went again to the nāga world, and saw that Amogha noose at the door of the nāga world.

analyzed: tasya etat abhavat
translated: He thought,

original: eṣa sa pāśo yo mayā prārthanīya iti viditvā nāgabhuvanaṃ praviṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: eṣa sa pāśaḥ yaḥ mayā prārthanīyaḥ iti viditvā nāga bhuvanam praviṣṭaḥ
translated: This is the noose that I should ask for. Knowing this, he entered the nāga world.

original: tato janmacitreṇa nāgapotenānyaiś ca nāgapotaiḥ sasaṃbhramaṃ pratisaṃmodito ratnaiś ca pravāritaḥ kathayati /
analyzed: tatas janmacitreṇa nāga potena anyaiḥ ca nāga potaiḥ sa saṃbhramam pratisaṃmoditaḥ ratnaiḥ ca pravāritaḥ kathayati
translated: Then the young nāga Jālinīprabha and the other young nāgas greeted him with respect and offered him jewels, but he said,🔽I do not need jewels or gold. I have come for the Amogha noose.

original: alaṃ me ratnaiḥ kiṃ tv etad amoghaṃ pāśaṃ mamānuprayaccheti /
analyzed: alam me ratnaiḥ kim tu etat amogham pāśam mama anuprayaccha iti
translated: Enough of jewels for me, but give me this unfailing noose.

analyzed: janmacitraḥ kathayati
translated: Jālinīprabha said:

analyzed: tava anena kim prayojanam
translated: What use is it to you?

analyzed: mad
translated: For us

analyzed: tu mahat prayojanam
translated: it is of great use.

analyzed: yadā garuḍa bhaya upadrutāḥ bhavāmaḥ tadā anena ātmānam rakṣāmaḥ
translated: When we are afflicted by the fear of Garuḍa, we protect ourselves with this.

analyzed: lubdhakaḥ kathayati
translated: The hunter said:

original: yuṣmākam eṣa garuḍabhayopadrutānām upayogaṃ gacchati mama tv anena satatam eva prayojanam /
analyzed: yuṣmākam eṣa garuḍa bhaya upadrutānām upayogam gacchati mama tu anena satatam eva prayojanam
translated: This is of use to you when afflicted by the fear of Garuḍa, but I always have use for it.

original: yady asti kṛtam upakṛtaṃ vā prayaccheti /
analyzed: yadi asti kṛtam upakṛtam vā prayaccha iti
translated: If you have done or are doing a favor, give it to me.

analyzed: janma citrasya nāga potasya etat abhavat
translated: Jālinīprabha, the young nāga, thought this:

analyzed: mama anena bahu upakṛtam mātā pitarā avalokya dadāmi iti
translated: I have been greatly helped by this. Looking after my mother and father, I will give it.

analyzed: tena mātā pitarau i
translated: He looked after his mother and father

analyzed: avalokya sa pāśaḥ dattaḥ
translated: and gave the noose.

original: tato 'sau lubdhakaḥ pṛthivīlabdhaprakhyena sukhasaumanasyenāpyāyitamanā amoghaṃ pāśam ādāya nāgabhuvanād abhyudgamya svagṛhaṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: tatas sau lubdhakaḥ pṛthivī labdha prakhyena sukha saumanasyena āpyāyita manāḥ amogham pāśam ādāya nāga bhuvanāt abhyudgamya sva gṛham gataḥ
translated: Then the hunter, his mind nourished with the happiness and joy of having obtained the earth, took the unfailing noose and, rising from the nāga realm, went to his own home.

original: yāvad apareṇa samayena dhano rājā devyā sārdhaṃ krīḍati ramate paricāryati /
analyzed: yāvat apareṇa samayena dhanaḥ rājā devyā sārdham krīḍati ramate paricāryati
translated: Later, King Dhana was playing, enjoying, and amusing himself with the queen.

original: tasya krīḍato ramamāṇasya paricārayato na putro na duhitā /
analyzed: tasya krīḍataḥ ramamāṇasya paricārayataḥ na putraḥ na duhitā
translated: While he was playing, enjoying, and amusing himself, he had neither a son nor a daughter.

original: sa kare kapolaṃ datvā cintāparo vyavasthitaḥ /
analyzed: sa kare kapolam da tvā cintā paraḥ vyavasthitaḥ
translated: He placed his hand on his cheek and sat there absorbed in thought.

original: anekadhanasamuditaṃ me gṛhaṃ na me putro na duhitā /🔽mamātyayāt svakulavaṃśacchede rāṣṭrāpahāraḥ /
analyzed: aneka dhana samuditam me gṛham na me putraḥ na duhitā  mama atyayāt sva kula vaṃśa chede rāṣṭra apahāraḥ
translated: My house is full of many kinds of wealth, but I have neither a son nor a daughter.🔽After my death, my family line will be cut off and the kingdom will be taken away.

original: sarvaṃ ca svāpateyam aputrakam iti kṛtvā rājavidheyaṃ bhaviṣyatīti /
analyzed: sarvam ca svāpateyam aputrakam iti kṛtvā rāja vidheyam bhaviṣyati iti
translated: And all my property will be considered ownerless and subject to royal confiscation.

analyzed: sa śramaṇa brāhmaṇa suhṛd saṃbandhi bāndhavaiḥ ucyate
translated: He was told by ascetics, brahmins, friends, relatives, and kinsmen:

analyzed: deva kim asi cintā paraḥ iti
translated: Your Majesty, why are you absorbed in thought?

analyzed: saḥ etat prakaraṇam teṣām vistareṇa ārocayati
translated: He explained that matter to them in detail.

analyzed: te kathayanti
translated: They said:

analyzed: devatā ārādhanam kuru putraḥ te bhaviṣyati iti
translated: Worship the gods. You will have a son.

original: so 'putraḥ putrābhinandī śivavaruṇakuberaśakrabrahmādīn anyāṃś ca devatāviśeṣān āyācate
analyzed: saḥ putraḥ putra abhinandī śiva varuṇa kubera śakra brahma ādīn anyān ca devatā viśeṣān āyācate
translated: He, being sonless and desiring a son, supplicated Śiva, Varuṇa, Kubera, Śakra, Brahmā, and other specific gods,

original: tadyathā ārāmadevatā vanadevatāś catvaradevatāḥ śṛṅgāṭakadevatā balipratigrāhikā
analyzed: tat yathā ārāma devatāḥ vana devatāḥ catvara devatāḥ śṛṅgāṭaka devatāḥ bali pratigrāhikā
translated: such as gods of groves, gods of forests, gods of crossroads, gods of junctions, and those who receive offerings,

original: devatāḥ sahajāḥ sahadharmikā nityānubaddhā api devatā āyācate /
analyzed: devatāḥ sahajāḥ sahadharmikāḥ nityānubaddhāḥ api devatāḥ āyācate
translated: Even though one has deities who are co-born and have the same qualities, and who are always attached, one requests deities.

original: asti caiṣa loke pravādo yadāyācanahetoḥ putrā jāyante duhitaraś ca /
analyzed: asti ca eṣa loke pravādaḥ yadā āyācana hetoḥ putrāḥ jāyante duhitaraḥ ca
translated: And there is this saying in the world: 'Sons and daughters are born because of requests.'

analyzed: tat ca na evam
translated: But that is not so.

original: yady evam abhaviṣyad ekaikasya putrasahasram abhaviṣyat tadyathā rājñaś cakravartinaḥ /
analyzed: yadi evam abhaviṣyat ekaikasya putra sahasram abhaviṣyat tat yathā rājñaḥ cakravartinaḥ
translated: If it were so, each person would have a thousand sons, like a wheel-turning king.

original: api tu trayāṇāṃ sthānānāṃ saṃmukhībhāvāt putrā jāyante duhitaraś ca /
analyzed: api tu trayāṇām sthānānām saṃmukhībhāvāt putrāḥ jāyante duhitaraḥ ca
translated: But sons and daughters are born due to the coming together of three factors.

analyzed: katameṣām trayāṇām
translated: What are the three?

analyzed: mātā pitarau raktau bhavataḥ
translated: The mother and father are passionate.

analyzed: saṃnipatitau
translated: They come together.

analyzed: mātā ca kalyā bhavati ritumatī
translated: And the mother is healthy and in season.

analyzed: gandharvaḥ ca pratyupasthitaḥ bhavati
translated: And a gandharva is present.

original: eṣāṃ trayāṇāṃ sthānānāṃ saṃmukhībhāvāt putrā jāyante duhitaraś ca /
analyzed: eṣām trayāṇām sthānānām saṃmukhībhāvāt putrāḥ jāyante duhitaraḥ ca
translated: Due to the coming together of these three factors, sons and daughters are born.

original: sa caivam āyācanaparas tiṣṭhati /🔽anyatamaś ca bhadrakalpiko MSV I
analyzed: sa ca evam āyācana paraḥ tiṣṭhati  anyatamaḥ ca bhadra kalpikaḥ msu i
translated: And he remained thus, intent on requesting.🔽And a certain bodhisattva of the auspicious eon

analyzed: bodhisatvaḥ tasyāḥ agramahiṣyāḥ kukṣim avakrāntaḥ
translated: conceived in the womb of that chief queen.

analyzed: paṃcāveṇikāḥ dharmāḥ ekatas paṇḍita jātīye mātṛgrāme
translated: There are five special qualities in a woman of a wise type.

analyzed: katame paṃca
translated: What are the five?

analyzed: raktam puruṣam jānāti  kālam jānāti
translated: She knows if it is a male child.🔽She knows the time.

analyzed: ṛtum jānāti  garbham avakrāntam jānāti
translated: She knows the season.🔽She knows when the embryo has entered.

original: yasya sakāśād garbho 'vakrāmati taṃ jānāti /🔽dārakaṃ jānāti /
analyzed: yasya sakāśāt garbhaḥ vakrāmati tam jānāti  dārakam jānāti
translated: She knows from whom the embryo has entered.🔽She knows if it is a boy.

analyzed: dārikām jānāti  saced dārakaḥ bhavati dakṣiṇam kukṣim niśritya tiṣṭhati
translated: She knows if it is a girl.🔽If it is a boy, it lies pressing on the right side of the womb.

analyzed: saced dārikā bhavati vāmam kukṣim niśritya tiṣṭhati
translated: If it is a girl, it lies pressing on the left side of the womb.

analyzed: sā ātta manāḥ ātta manāḥ svāminā ārocayati
translated: She, being delighted and joyful, informs her husband:

analyzed: diṣṭyā āryaputra vardhase
translated: By good luck, noble sir, you are prospering.

analyzed: āpannasatvā asmi saṃvṛttā
translated: I have become pregnant.

original: yathā ca me dakṣiṇakukṣiṃ niśritya tiṣṭhati niyataṃ dārako bhaviṣyatīti fol / GBM / /🔽so 'py āttamanāttamanāḥ pūrvaṃ kāyam abhyunnamayya
analyzed: yathā ca me dakṣiṇa kukṣim niśritya tiṣṭhati niyatam dārakaḥ bhū iti  saḥ pi ātta manāḥ ātta manāḥ pūrvam kāyam abhyunnamayya
translated: And because it lies pressing on my right side, surely it will be a boy.🔽He, being delighted and joyful, raises his right arm

analyzed: dakṣiṇa bāhum abhiprasārya udānam udānayati
translated: and utters a cry of joy:

analyzed: api eva aham cira kāla abhilaṣitam putra mukham paśyeyam
translated: At last I will see the face of a son, for whom I have longed for a long time.

analyzed: sama jātaḥ me syāt na avajātaḥ
translated: He will be born in my family, not outside it.

analyzed: kṛtyāni me kurvīta  bhṛtaḥ pratibibhṛyāt
translated: He will do my work for me.🔽He will support me when I am old.

analyzed: dāyādyam pratipadyeta
translated: He will take possession of my inheritance.

analyzed: kula vaṃśaḥ me cirasthitikaḥ syāt
translated: May my family lineage last for a long time.

original: asmākaṃ cāpy atītakālagatānām alpaṃ vā prabhūtaṃ vā dānāni datvā puṇyāni kṛtvā asmākaṃ nāmnā dakṣiṇām ādekṣyate /
analyzed: asmākam ca api atīta kāla gatānām alpam vā prabhūtam vā dānāni da tvā puṇyāni kṛtvā asmākam nāmnā dakṣiṇām ādekṣyate
translated: And for us who have passed away, having given little or much in charity and performed meritorious deeds, may they dedicate the offerings in our names.

original: idaṃ tayor yatra tatropapannayor gacchator anugacchatv iti /
analyzed: idam tayoḥ yatra tatra upapannayoḥ gacchatoḥ anugacchatu iti
translated: May this follow them wherever they go.'

original: āpannasatvāṃ caināṃ viditvā upari prāsādatalagatām ayantritāṃ dhārayati śīte śītopakaraṇair uṣṇe uṣṇopakaraṇair vaidyaprajñaptair MSV I
analyzed: āpannasatvām ca enām viditvā upari prāsāda tala gatām a yantritām dhārayati śīte śīta upakaraṇaiḥ uṣṇe uṣṇa upakaraṇaiḥ vaidya prajñaptaiḥ
translated: And knowing that she is pregnant, he keeps her on the upper terrace, protected, with cool things in the heat, with warm things in the cold, with foods prescribed by physicians,

original: āhārair nātitiktair nātyamlair nātilavaṇair nātimadhurakair nātikaṭukair nātikaṣāyais
analyzed: āhāraiḥ na ati tiktaiḥ na ati amlaiḥ na ati lavaṇaiḥ na ati madhurakaiḥ na ati kaṭukaiḥ na ati kaṣāyaiḥ
translated: with meals that are not too bitter, too sour, too salty, too sweet, too sharp, or too astringent.

analyzed: tikta amla lavaṇa madhura kaṭuka kaṣāya vivarjitaiḥ āhāraiḥ hāra ardhahāra vibhūṣita gātrīm
translated: With meals free from bitterness, sourness, saltiness, sweetness, sharpness, and astringency, her body adorned with necklaces and half-necklaces,

analyzed: apsarasam iva nandana vana vihāriṇīm mañcāt mañcam pīṭhāt pīṭham avatarantīm adharimām bhūmim
translated: like a celestial nymph roaming in the Nandana Grove, moving from bed to bed, from seat to seat, descending to the lower ground.

original: na cāsyāḥ kiṃcid amanojñaśabdaśravaṇaṃ yāvad eva garbhasya paripākāya /
analyzed: na ca asyāḥ kiṃcid a manojña śabda śravaṇam yāvat eva garbhasya paripākāya
translated: And she hears nothing unpleasant until the embryo is fully developed.'

original: sā aṣṭānāṃ vā navānāṃ vā māsānām atyayāt prasūtā /
analyzed: sā aṣṭānām vā navānām vā māsānām atyayāt prasūtā
translated: After nine months had passed, she gave birth.

analyzed: dārakaḥ jātaḥ
translated: A boy was born,

original: abhirūpo darśanīyaḥ prāsādiko gauraḥ kanakavarṇaś chatrākāraśirāḥ pralambabāhur vistīrṇalalāṭaḥ uccaghoṣaḥ saṃgatabrūs tuṅganāsaḥ sarvāṅgapratyaṅgopetaḥ
analyzed: abhirūpaḥ darśanīyaḥ prāsādikaḥ gauraḥ kanaka varṇaḥ chatra ākāra śirāḥ pralamba bāhuḥ vistīrṇa lalāṭaḥ ucca ghoṣaḥ saṃgata brūḥ tuṅga nāsaḥ sarva aṅga pratyaṅga upetaḥ
translated: handsome, good-looking, and pleasant, fair, with a golden complexion, a head shaped like a turban, long arms, a broad forehead, a prominent nose, and endowed with all the major and minor marks.

analyzed: tasya jātau ānanda bheryaḥ tāḍitāḥ
translated: When he was born, drums of joy were beaten.

analyzed: śrutvā rājā kathayati
translated: Hearing this, the king said,

analyzed: kim etat iti
translated: What is this?

analyzed: antaḥpurikābhiḥ rājñe niveditam
translated: The women of the harem reported to the king,

original: deva diṣṭyā vardhase putras te jāta iti /
analyzed: deva diṣṭyā vardhase putraḥ te jātaḥ iti
translated: Your Majesty, congratulations! A son has been born to you.

The terrible Yaksha-Rakshasa with tawny-brown hair and eyes,

translated: Now he is being executed.🔽It would not be right for me

analyzed: yat aham api upekṣeya
translated: to ignore this.”

original: iti viditvā parāvṛtya rājñaḥ sakāśam upasaṃkrāntaḥ pādayor nipatya kathayati /
analyzed: iti viditvā parāvṛtya rājñaḥ sakāśam upasaṃkrāntaḥ pādayoḥ nipatya kathayati
translated: Knowing this, he turned back, went to the king, fell at his feet and said,

original: deva nāyaṃ pravrajito 'sya karmaṇaḥ kārī mayaitat pāpakaṃ karma kṛtam /
analyzed: deva na ayam karmaṇaḥ kārī mayā etat pāpakam karma kṛtam

analyzed: mucyatām ayam pravrajitaḥ iti
translated: Let this renunciant go.

analyzed: kim manyadhve bhikṣavaḥ
translated: What do you think, monks?

original: yo 'sau mṛṇālo nāma dhūrtaḥ ahaṃ sa tena kālena tena samayena /
analyzed: yaḥ sau mṛṇālaḥ nāma dhūrtaḥ aham sa tena kālena tena samayena
translated: The one named Mṛṇāla, the rogue, at that time, on that occasion, was me.

original: yan mayā pratyekabuddho 'bhūtenābhyākhyātas tasyāhaṃ karmaṇo vipākena bahūni varṣāṇi pūrvavad yāvan narakeṣu pakvaḥ /
analyzed: yat mayā pratyekabuddhaḥ bhūtena abhyākhyātaḥ tasya aham karmaṇaḥ vipākena bahūni varṣāṇi pūrvavat yāvat narakeṣu pakvaḥ
translated: Because I falsely accused the Pratyekabuddha, as a result of that karma, for many years, as before, I was cooked in the hells.

original: tena ca MSV I karmāvaśeṣeṇa caṃcāmāṇavikayā abhūtenākhyātaḥ /
analyzed: tena ca msu i karma avaśeṣeṇa caṃcā māṇavikayā a bhūtena ākhyātaḥ
translated: And because of the remainder of that karma, I was falsely accused by Cañcā Māṇavikā.

analyzed: idam asādhāraṇam
translated: This is the extraordinary [part of the story].

original: kiṃ bhadanta bhagavatā karma kṛtaṃ yasya karmaṇo vipākena vairaṃbheṣu yavān paribhuktavān
analyzed: kim bhadanta bhagavatā karma kṛtam yasya karmaṇaḥ vipākena vairaṃbheṣu yavān paribhuktavān
translated: Venerable, what karma was created by the Blessed One, as a result of which karma he ate barley in Vairambhya,

original: sārdhaṃ bhikṣudvayonaiḥ pañcabhir bhikṣuśatair āyuṣman śāriputramaudgalyāyanābhyāṃ
analyzed: sārdham bhikṣu dvaya ūnaiḥ pañcabhiḥ bhikṣu śataiḥ āyuṣman śāriputra maudgalyāyanābhyām
translated: together with two other monks and five hundred monks, with the Venerable Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana,

analyzed: divyā sudhā paribhuktā iti
translated: and ate divine nectar?

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:🔽Monks, the karma that I created has a remainder. The karma that was created by the Venerable Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana has been exhausted.

original: tathāgatenaiva bhikṣavaḥ pūrvam anyāsu jātiṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni /
analyzed: tathāgatena eva bhikṣavaḥ pūrvam anyāsu jātiṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni
translated: Monks, the Tathāgata himself performed and accumulated these actions in the past,

analyzed: pūrvavat yāvat phalanti khalu dehinām
translated: as before, up to: actions come to fruition upon embodied beings.

original: yo 'śītivarṣasahasrāyuṣi prajāyāṃ vipaśyī nāma śāstā loka utpannaḥ /
analyzed: śīti varṣa sahasra āyuṣi prajāyām vipaśyī nāma śāstā loke utpannaḥ
translated: When the lifespan of beings was eighty thousand years, a teacher named Vipaśyin arose in the world,

analyzed: pūrvavat yāvat buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: a buddha, a blessed one, as before, up to:

analyzed: sa janapada cārikām caran bandhumatī rājadhānīm anuprāptaḥ
translated: He, wandering through the country, arrived at the capital city of Bandhumatī.

original: tasyāṃ bandhumatyām anyatamo brāhmaṇaḥ paṇcamāṇavakaśatāni brāhmaṇānāṃ mantrān vācayati /
analyzed: tasyām bandhumatyām anyatamaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ paṇca māṇavaka śatāni brāhmaṇānām mantrān vācayati
translated: In that Bandhumatī, a certain brāhmaṇa was teaching the Vedas to five hundred young brāhmaṇas.

analyzed: tena vipaśyī samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ pañca śata parivāraḥ dṛṣṭaḥ
translated: He saw the Perfectly Awakened One Vipaśyin with an entourage of five hundred.

analyzed: sa māṇavakān āmantrayate
translated: He said to the young brāhmaṇas:

original: nārhanti bhavanto 'mī muṇḍakāḥ śramaṇakā divyāṃ sudhām arhanti tu koṭarayavān paribhoktum iti /
analyzed: na arhanti bhavantaḥ mī muṇḍakāḥ śramaṇakāḥ divyām sudhām arhanti tu koṭara yavān paribhoktum iti
translated: You, sirs, should not eat divine nectar, but you should eat rotten barley.

analyzed: taiḥ abhyanumoditam
translated: They approved of it, saying:

original: evam evaitad upādhyāya nārhanty evāmī muṇḍakāḥ śramaṇakā divyāṃ sudhāṃ / bhoktum arhanti tu koṭarayavān paribhoktum iti /
analyzed: evam eva etat upādhyāya na arhanti eva amī muṇḍakāḥ śramaṇakāḥ divyām sudhām bhoktum arhanti tu koṭara yavān paribhoktum iti
translated: Exactly so, teacher! These shaven-headed ascetics should not eat divine nectar, but they should eat rotten barley.

analyzed: tatra dvau māṇavakau śuklau
translated: There were two young brahmins who were fair.

analyzed: tau kathayataḥ
translated: They said,

analyzed: upādhyāya na śobhanam uktam
translated: Teacher, you have not spoken well.

original: arhanty evāmī mahātmāno divyāṃ sudhāṃ paribhoktum iti /
analyzed: arhanti eva amī mahātmānaḥ divyām sudhām paribhoktum iti
translated: These great beings deserve to enjoy divine nectar.

analyzed: kim manyadhve bhikṣavaḥ
translated: What do you think, monks?

original: yo 'sau pañcaśataparivāro brāhmaṇaḥ aham eva sa tena kālena tena samayena /
analyzed: yaḥ sau pañcaśata parivāraḥ brāhmaṇaḥ aham eva sa tena kālena tena samayena
translated: The brahmin who was surrounded by five hundred at that time, on that occasion, was indeed me.

original: yan mayā vipaśyinaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya saśrāvakasaṃghasyāntike kharaṃ MSV I
analyzed: yat mayā vipaśyinaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya sa śrāvaka saṃghasya antike
translated: The harsh words I spoke to the perfectly awakened Vipaśyin and his community of disciples,

original: vākkarma niścāritaṃ tasya karmaṇo vipākena mayā bahūni varṣāṇi bahūni varṣaśatāni bahūni varṣasahasrāṇi bahūni varṣaśatasahasrāṇi koṭarayavāḥ 🔽paribhuktāḥ /
analyzed: vāc karma niścāritam tasya karmaṇaḥ vipākena mayā bahūni varṣāṇi bahūni varṣa śatāni bahūni varṣa sahasrāṇi bahūni varṣa śata sahasrāṇi koṭara yavāḥ  paribhuktāḥ
translated: as a result of that karma, for many years, for many hundreds of years, for many thousands of years, for many hundreds of thousands of years, I ate only husks.

original: tenaiva karmāvaśeṣeṇaitarhy apy abhisaṃbuddhabodhinā vairambheṣu koṭarayavāḥ paribhuktāḥ sārdhaṃ bhikṣudvayonaiḥ paṃcabhikṣuśataiḥ /
analyzed: tena eva karma avaśeṣeṇa etarhi api abhisaṃbuddha bodhinā vairambheṣu koṭara yavāḥ paribhuktāḥ sārdham bhikṣu dvaya ūnaiḥ paṃca bhikṣu śataiḥ
translated: Because of the remainder of that karma, even now, after attaining enlightenment, I ate husks in Vairambhya, together with two other monks and five hundred monks.

original: yau tau dvau māṇavakau etau śāriputramaudgalyāyanau bhikṣū /
analyzed: yau tau dvau māṇavakau etau śāriputra maudgalyāyanau bhikṣū
translated: Those two young brahmins were the monks Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana.

original: kiṃ bhadanta bhagavatā karma kṛtaṃ yasya karmaṇo vipākena duṣkaraṃ caritam iti /
analyzed: kim bhadanta bhagavatā karma kṛtam yasya karmaṇaḥ vipākena duṣkaram caritam iti
translated: What karma did the Blessed One create, that he should experience the difficulty of practicing austerities as a result of that karma?

original: bhagavān āha tathāgatenaiva tāni bhikṣavaḥ pūrvam anyāsu jātiṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni pūrvavad yāvat phalanti khalu dehinām /
analyzed: bhagavān āha tathāgatena eva tāni bhikṣavaḥ pūrvam anyāsu jātiṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni pūrvavat yāvat phalanti khalu dehinām
translated: The Blessed One said, Monks, those actions were performed and accumulated by the Tathāgata himself in other births, in the past, in the course of his cyclic existence, before his perfect enlightenment. For actions done do not ripen in the earth element, nor in the water element, nor in the fire element, nor in the wind element. Rather, actions done ripen in what is called the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, bound to the life-faculty, not separable from it, following along.

original: bhūtapūrvaṃ bhikṣavo vaibhiḍiṃgyāṃ grāmanigame nandīpālo ghaṭīkāro 'bhūt /
analyzed: bhūta pūrvam bhikṣavaḥ vaibhiḍiṃgyām grāma nigame nandīpālaḥ ghaṭī kāraḥ bhūt
translated: Monks, in the past, in the village of Vaibhīḍiṅga, there was a potter named Nāḍīpāla.

original: nandīpālasūtraṃ vistareṇa yathā madhyamāgame rājasaṃyuktanikāye Cf / SBV II / /
analyzed: nandīpāla sūtram vistareṇa yathā madhyama āgame rāja saṃyukta nikāye
translated: The Nāḍīpāla Sūtra should be told in detail, as in the Middle Length Āgamas and in the Connected Discourses.

analyzed: kim manyadhve bhikṣavaḥ
translated: What do you think, monks?

original: yo 'sāv uttaro nāmo māṇavo 'ham eva sa tena kālena tena samayena /
analyzed: yaḥ sau uttaraḥ nāma māṇavaḥ ham eva sa tena kālena tena samayena
translated: The young brahmin named Uttara at that time, on that occasion, was none other than myself.

analyzed: yat mayā pudgalaḥ upavādaḥ dattasya
translated: Because I gave a false accusation against a person,

analyzed: pudgalaḥ vabodhitaḥ na boditaḥ tasya
translated: I accused a person who was not enlightened.

original: karmaṇo vipākena bodhimūle ṣaḍvarṣaṃ duṣkaraṃ caritam /
analyzed: karmaṇaḥ vipākena bodhi mūle ṣaṣ varṣam duṣkaram caritam
translated: As a result of that karma, I practiced austerities at the foot of the Bodhi tree for six years.

original: yan mayā bodhir abodhitābhaviṣyat punar api mayā MSV I
analyzed: yat mayā bodhiḥ a bodhitā abhaviṣyat punar api mayā
translated: If I had not attained enlightenment, I would have to practice austerities again for many eons.

original: parāvṛtya trīṇi kalpāsaṃkhyeyāni bodhinimittam ātmā parikhedito 'bhaviṣyat /
analyzed: parāvṛtya trīṇi kalpa asaṃkhyeyāni bodhi nimittam ātmā parikheditaḥ bhaviṣyat
translated: If he had turned back, he would have exhausted himself for three incalculable eons for the sake of enlightenment.

original: kiṃ bhadanta bhagavatā karma kṛtaṃ yasya karmaṇo vipākenābhisaṃbuddhabodhir api bhagavān mandāgninā vyādhinā spṛṣṭa iti /
analyzed: kim bhadanta bhagavatā karma kṛtam yasya karmaṇaḥ vipākena abhisaṃbuddha bodhiḥ api bhagavān manda agninā vyādhinā spṛṣṭaḥ iti
translated: Venerable Sir, what karma did the Blessed One create that ripened such that even after attaining enlightenment, the Blessed One was afflicted by a severe illness?

original: bhagavān āha tathāgatenaiva tāni bhikṣavaḥ pūrvam anyāsu jātiṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni pūrvavad yāvat phalanti khalu dehinām /
analyzed: bhagavān āha tathāgatena eva tāni bhikṣavaḥ pūrvam anyāsu jātiṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni pūrvavat yāvat phalanti khalu dehinām
translated: The Blessed One said, Monks, those actions were created and accumulated by the Tathāgata himself in other births, in the past, as explained before. Actions do not ripen upon the external elements, nor do they ripen upon the internal elements without having been done. But actions done do not perish even in one hundred eons.

analyzed: bhūtapurvam bhikṣavaḥ karvaṭake vaidyaḥ babhūva
translated: Monks, in the past, in a certain village, there was a physician.

original: tato 'nyatamasya gṛhapateḥ putraḥ glānaḥ saṃvṛttaḥ /🔽tenāsau vaidya āhūya pṛṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: tatas nyatamasya gṛhapateḥ putraḥ glānaḥ saṃvṛttaḥ  tena asau vaidyaḥ āhūya pṛṣṭaḥ
translated: Then the son of a certain householder became ill.🔽He summoned that physician and asked him.

analyzed: tena tasya bhaiṣajyam dattam
translated: He gave him medicine.

analyzed: sa svasthaḥ saṃvṛttaḥ
translated: He became well.

analyzed: tena gṛhapatinā tasya abhisāraḥ na dattaḥ
translated: But that householder did not give him a reward.

original: yāvat trir apy asau gṛhapatiputro glānaḥ saṃvṛttaḥ yāvat trir api tena svasthīkṛtaḥ /
analyzed: yāvat tris api asau gṛhapati putraḥ glānaḥ saṃvṛttaḥ yāvat tris api tena svasthīkṛtaḥ
translated: Then, up to three times, that householder's son became ill, up to three times he was cured by him.

analyzed: na ca tena tasya abhisāraḥ dattaḥ
translated: But he did not give him a reward.

original: tataḥ sa vaidyas tīvreṇa paryavasthānenāmarṣitaḥ saṃlakṣayati /
analyzed: tatas sa vaidyaḥ tīvreṇa paryavasthānena amarṣitaḥ saṃlakṣayati
translated: Then that physician, feeling intense indignation, thought:

analyzed: asya gṛhapati putrasya mayā yāvat tris api cikitsā kṛtā
translated: For this son of a householder, I have performed treatment up to three times.

analyzed: na ca anena kiṃcid api upakṛtam
translated: And he has not benefited me at all.

original: idānīṃ yadi bhūyo glānyaṃ patati tādṛśam asya bhaiṣajyaṃ dadāmi yenāsyāntrāṇi khaṇḍakhaṇḍaṃ śīryante iti /
analyzed: idānīm yadi bhūyaḥ glānyam patati tādṛśam asya bhaiṣajyam dadāmi yena asya antrāṇi khaṇḍa khaṇḍam śīryante iti
translated: Now, if he falls ill again, I will give him such medicine that his intestines will break into pieces.

original: yāvad asau gṛhapatiputro daivayogāt punar glānyaṃ patitaḥ /
analyzed: yāvat asau gṛhapati putraḥ daiva yogāt punar glānyam patitaḥ
translated: Then, by the power of fate, that son of a householder fell ill again.

original: tena vaidyena saṃjātāmarṣeṇā tādṛśaṃ tasya bhaiṣajyaṃ dattaṃ yenāntrāṇi khaṇḍa / / /
analyzed: tena vaidyena saṃjāta amarṣeṇa tādṛśam tasya bhaiṣajyam dattam yena antrāṇi
translated: That physician, feeling indignant, gave him such medicine that his intestines broke into pieces, and he died.
